Tiene varias parcelas de terreno y cuando llega los días de cosecha necesita invertir mucho dinero en el pago de personal, por eso siembra cada mes. Por ejemplo, la cosecha de sus espinacas la solventará con la ganancia de las ventas de coliflor. Para ello, Alina tiene que trabajar coordinadamente con su esposo.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y éste es su cuarto crédito 4 con MFP. Siente agradecimiento por el apoyo brindado hasta ahora, por eso dice que pagará puntualmente las cuotas mensuales.
Alina destinará el dinero que solicita en completar el presupuesto que tiene para adquirir 5 bolsas de semillas de arvejas, lo que le costará aproximadamente 2800 soles.
texts.en:
Alina, 33, lives with Diego with whom she has two children: Sarai and Cristofer.  Her house is hers and it’s located in Huaracayo settlement in Tarma.

She is a woman in agriculture.  Every morning she heads out to the settlement where the farmland is located where she’s growing potatoes, corn, peas and greens.  “The work is tiring even more so when planting or harvest seasons arrive which is why my husband and I hire personnel,” she affirms.

One of the inconveniences she has to deal with every planting season is the infestations that attack the fruit but Alina is persistent and intelligent and knows how to counteract these problems.  She has several parcels of land and when harvest time comes she has to invest much money to pay staff and that’s why she plants each month.  For example, planting her spinach crop will be paid for by profits from cauliflower sales.  To do so, Alina has to work in a coordinated fashion with her husband.

She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” communal bank and this is her 4th loan with MFP.  She feels grateful for the support provided to date and that’s why she says she’ll make her monthly installment payments punctually.

Alina will use the requested money to complete her budget to buy five sacks of pea seeds that will cost her approximately 2800 soles.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Las Rosas De María Group

texts.es: La Sra. Armandina de 58 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya no dependen de ella. Tiene 3 años con Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como gaseosas, refrescos, detergentes, arroz, azúcar, etc. desde hace 8 años. Comenzó con la venta de pan en su domicilio hasta que poco a poco fue incrementando su mercadería. También se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 2 años. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado comprarse un auto. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a la compra de mercadería y pago de servicios. Su plan para el futuro es terminar de construir su casa. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. Armandina pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Las Rosas de María”, con el cual tiene 3 años y esta conformado por 7 personas. Lleva el cargo de presidenta desde hace 1 año.
texts.en:
Armandina is 58 years old. She is single and has 2 children who no longer depend on her. She has been with Edaprospo for 3 years and has spent the last 8 years selling general groceries such as sodas, soft drinks, detergents, rice, sugar, etc. She started out selling bread from her home until little by little she began to expand her merchandise. She has also been selling cosmetics for 2 years. Through her work and her effort, she has been able to buy herself a car.  

She now uses her income to buy merchandise and to pay for services. Her plan for the future is to finish building her house. She used the credit to buy merchandise for her business. For 3 years, Armandina has been a member of "Las Rosas de María" communal banking group which is comprised of 7 members. She has been the group's president for 1 year.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda tiene 53 años, vive con su pareja, con el que tiene 2 hijos de 26 y 22 años, pero que ya no viven con ella. Herlinda y su esposo viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Acobamba en Tarma.

Su vitalidad y coraje lo demuestra con sus logros obtenidos, como el haber conseguido sus terrenos propios y una casa propia. A pesar de algunas limitaciones pudo pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, y todo esto gracias a la siembra de arvejas, habas, maíz, lechugas, coles, zanahorias, espinacas y otras hortalizas, que le proporcionaron buenas utilidades. 
En la actualidad sus cosechas son muy cotizadas en el mercado central de la ciudad y en las campañas agrícolas se contacta con compradores de diferentes ciudades, inclusive de la capital. 
Pero consciente d ue las campañas agrícolas no duran todo el año, varía sus cultivos de acuerdo a la demanda. “Estos meses es campaña de arvejas, a partir de junio las hortalizas y en diciembre el maíz”, menciona.
Herlinda siente que en todos sus años de vida se ha esforzado mucho, por eso trabajará para ahorrar y más adelante descansar, pues sus fuerzas no serán las mismas.

Éste es su crédito número 11 con MFP y al igual que en los ciclos anteriores pagará puntualmente. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay - Bellavista”, uno de los más antiguos de su localidad y se siente contenta de ser parte de un grupo sólido, por eso no dudó en aceptar el cargo de presidente.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá comprar seis bolsas de semillas de arveja para iniciar con fuerza la campaña grande.
texts.en:
Herlinda, 53, lives with her spouse with whom she has two children who are 26 and 22 years old but no longer living with her.   Herlinda and her husband live in their own home located in Tarma’s Acobamba District.

Her vitality and courage are proven by her achievements like having obtained her own farmland and her own house.  Despite some limitations she managed to pay her children’s university education and all of this was thanks to planting peas, lima beans, corn, lettuce, cabbage, carrots, spinach and other greens that produce good profits.

Her crops are currently highly sought after in the city’s central market and during planting seasons she’s in contact with buyers in different cities including the capital.

But she’s conscious of the fact that planting seasons don’t last all year so she varies her crops according to demand.  “These months are pea season and June is greens and December is corn,” she mentions.

Herlinda feels that she’s worked hard her entire life and this is why she’ll work to save so that she can rest later on because her strength won’t be the same.

This is loan #11 with MFP and just like in past cycles she will make her payments punctually.  She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay-Bellavista” communal bank one of the oldest in her location and she feels happy to be part of such a solid group which is why she didn’t hesitate to accept the post of president.

With the money she’s asking for now she will be able to buy six bags of pea seeds to start the big planting season powerfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Maria Olinda

texts.es:
María es una mujer de  24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, cuenta con 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en casa propia,en el caserío San Isidro, distrito de Mòrrope, departamento de Lambayeque. La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia la mayoría son trabajadores independientes  dedicados al comercio, crianza de animales y adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura.  Así mismo cuentan solo con el servicio básico de  Energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de pozos artesanales; todas las familias viven bajo estas condiciones.


La actividad  principal a la que se dedica María  es la crianza/venta de  animales como: ovinos, caprinos, porcinos y aves de corral, estos los alimenta a base de concentrado en corrales que se encuentran en la parte exterior de su casa; ella cuenta con experiencia suficiente para este tipo de negocio, donde la comercialización lo realiza a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; así mismo su  cónyuge esta dedicado a  la agricultura donde le apoya en la canasta familiar. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando María es de S/. 2,500 nuevos soles, se destinara para la compra de alimentos balanceados, aves, porcinos y caprinos  para la cría. Y arreglo de corrales. Actualmente  se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 24 year old woman who lives in a common law relationship and has two minor children who are dependent on her. She lives with her partner and children in their own home in the San Isidro neighborhood in Mórrope District, in Lambayeque Department. The quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level. Most are independent workers engaged in trade, animal husbandry and also agriculture. Their only basic service is electricity and they consume water from artesian wells. All the families live under these conditions.

María’s primary activity is raising and selling animals such as sheep, goats, pigs and chickens. She feeds them nutritious feed in corrals that are outside the house. She has had sufficient experience in this type of business where she markets the animals to wholesale traders in the area. Her partner is a farmer, which enables him to help with basic necessities. 

María is applying for a loan of S/. 2,500 and will use it to purchase nutritional feed, chickens, pigs and goats to raise, and to repair her corrals. Currently she has proposed expanding her inventory in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase nutritional feed, animals and to repair her corrals.

loans.name: Jeanne D`arc

texts.en:
Jeanne d`Arc is 51 years old and a widow with four children between 10 and 26 years old. She sells various fruits such as bananas, passion fruits, pineapple, etc. and she has been in this business for four years. Her business is open from 8 am to 9 pm every day of the week. 

Jeanne d`Arc has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various fruits such as bananas, passion fruits, pineapple, etc. to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy bananas, passion fruits, pineapple, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 39 years old, married to David and blessed with three children. She is a tailor who has been doing dressmaking for the last six years. Her monthly income is KES 9,000. This is her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET. She plans to purchase a variety of dress materials, knitting wools and clothes for use in her business.

The anticipated profits will be used to support her business expansion. Her future plans are to own a residential house for her family and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing and dress materials

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single mother who is 25 years old. She is blessed with two children who are nine and six years old.  She has been selling fruits and vegetables for a period of seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.  

She is requesting her first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this loan to purchase vegetables and a variety of fruits to sell.  

The anticipated profits will be used to reinvest in the business and repay the loan.  Her future dream is to start a hotel business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
Teofila tiene 56 años, está casada y tiene siete hijos, pero sólo tres están en su poder. Ella vive con sus hijos, ya que su esposo está en la ciudad de Lima en tratamiento médico.

Los días de está valiente mujer se centran en el trabajo agrícola. Desde los 20 años se dedica a las labores del campo y en todo ese tiempo logró adquirir, gracias a su esfuerzo, sus propios terrenos agrícolas, su pequeña casa y sacar a sus hijos adelante. Quienes ahora le ayudan en mantener sus sembríos de papa, arvejas y otras hortalizas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo con su familia. “Tengo cuatro hijos que están en Lima estudiando y les envió dinero para que terminen de estudiar, son mi orgullo”, afirma.
Teofila está preocupada por la salud de su esposo quien se encuentra en la ciudad capital al cuidado de sus hijos mayores, pero ella los visita con frecuencia, llevando sus productos para vender en el mercado mayorista. Ahora se hará cargo sola de las siembras de arvejas y maíz, para ello contratará operarios.

Gracias a la invitación de sus vecinos ingresó como socia al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y éste sería su primer crédito con MFP; por el que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará bolsas de fertilizantes para garantizar el crecimiento de sus arvejas y papas.
texts.en:
Teófila, 56, is married and has seven children but only three still depend on her.  She lives with her children since her husband is undergoing medical treatment in the city of Lima.

This brave woman’s days are centered on agriculture.  Since the age of 20 she’s been working in the fields and in all this time she’s managed to acquire, thanks to her efforts, her own farmland, her little house and to raise her children who now help her maintain her potato, pea and other greens crops.  What she likes best about her work is being able to spend most of her time with her family.  “I have four children studying in Lima and I send them money so that they can finish their studies; they are my pride,” she affirms.

Teófila is worried about her husband’s health who is in the capital being cared for by their older children but she visits frequently taking products to sell in the wholesale market.  She will now take care of the pea and corn crops and to do so will hire laborers.

Thanks to an invitation by her neighbors she joined the “Señor de Muruhuay” communal bank and this will be her first loan with MFP and she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.

She will use the requested money to buy sacks of fertilizer to insure the growth of her peas and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Martha Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Martha , es habitante del municipio  de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo , el cual labora para una empresa privada , para apoyarle con los gasto s del hogar , ellos tienen hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , principalmente hacer una vivienda digna , doña Martha desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de pitahaya , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo , ella está muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos Kiva ya que son mucha las mujeres que se dedican a los trabajos del campos y logran sacar sus cosechas gracias al apoyo que reciben de los préstamos  otorgados  . El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes e insumos.
texts.en: Mrs Martha and her husband are residents of the Ticuantepe municipality.  He works for a private company to help cover the expenses of the household.  They have children.  Their future plans are to improve their quality of life, and mainly to build a proper house.  Mrs. Martha has been growing dragon fruit for several years.  Her main challenge are the pests that attack the fruit.  She is very happy with the support that she gets from Afondenic through the Kiva funds.  There are many women that make a living in the fields and are able to harvest their crops thanks to the help that they receive through the loans.  She needs this loan for the purchase of fertilizers and supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Together As One Iv Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Together As One IV” group. These small-scale entrepreneurs have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each of them to invest in their businesses. 

Momoh is the leader of this group. Momoh is 42 years old and married with three children. One of his children is in primary school and two are in secondary school. Momoh owns a grocery shop and has been doing this business for 17 years. With the help of this loan, he will invest in his business by buying items like milk, sugar, mayonnaise, butter, cheese, etc. to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy items like milk, sugar, mayonnaise, butter, cheese, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ana Elvira

texts.es: Ana accedió u a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará materias primas y accesorios para la confección como telas, hilos, encajes, botones, adornos y herrajes. Ella dice a LOS Financiadores de Kiva: “Estoy muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida, la mejor forma de demostrarlo es pagando puntualmente las cuotas del préstamo”. Con su anterior credikiva compró herrajes, botones adornos, telas  y accesorios con el cuales muy seguramente hizo muchos productos con los que dio rienda suelta a su imaginación y sobre todo ganó dinero.
texts.en:
Ana obtained a new Kiva loan, which she will use to buy raw materials and accessories for making clothes.  She will buy things like fabric, thread, lace, buttons, trim, and adornments.  

She says to the Kiva lendors, “I am very grateful for the help received.  The best way to show that is by making my loan payments punctually.”

With her previous Kiva loan she bought adornments, buttons, decorations, fabric, and accessories.  She very surely used them to make many products, which gave her imagination free reign.  Above all, she made money.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and accessories like fabric, thread, lace, buttons, trim, and adornments to make clothes.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde pequeño pues su padre falleció cuando el apenas tenía 3 años. Junto con sus hermanos y su madre trabajaba en las fincas aprendiendo todo lo relacionado con el café, desde sembrarlo, cosecharlo, procesarlo y hasta buscar clientes para su colocación en el mercado. El café que Gonzalo produce es orgánico ya que el fertilizante que utiliza el mismo lo prepara y no utiliza productos químicos para ello. Gonzalo es socio de la “Unión Regional Huatusco” y esta organización lo apoya con planta de café y abono orgánico. Para las labores que se requieren en su cafetal Gonzalo contrata personal para que lo ayuden, contribuyendo así a la economía de estas personas y su familia. Dentro de sus cafetales tiene sembrados algunos árboles frutales que le sirven para dar sombra a la planta de café. Para la próxima cosecha él necesita sembrar nuevas plantas pues cuenta con media hectárea en su finca que esta sin sembrar y también necesita hacer labores culturales de limpieza y conservación de la tierra y por eso el necesita de un crédito. Actualmente los hijos de Gonzalo ya terminaron su carrera universitaria así que él tiene como objetivo poner dentro de un poco de tiempo un expendio de café junto con sus hijos, su esposa y un sobrino para que las personas de su localidad puedan disfrutar de su café, ya que la mayoría de su producción es exportada.
texts.en:
Gonzalo has found it necessary to work since he was very young, as his father passed away when he was barely three years old.

Together with his siblings and his mother, he worked on farms, learning everything related to coffee: from planting it, harvesting it, processing it, to seeking customers for marketing it. The coffee that Gonzalo produces is organic, as the fertilizer that he uses he prepares himself, and he does not use chemical products for this purpose. 

Gonzalo is a member of the “Unión Regional Huatusco”, and this organization helps him with coffee plants and organic fertilizer. For the work needed in  his coffee plantation, Gonzalo hires laborers to help him, in this way contributing to the finances of these people and their families.

In his coffee farm, he has planted some fruit trees that are good for giving shade to the coffee plants. For the next harvest, he needs to plant new seedlings, as he has a half hectare on his farm that is unplanted. He also needs to do clearing and soil conservation work, and that is why he needs a loan. 

Now Gonzalo's children have completed their university degrees, so his goal is to set up, within a short time, a sales outlet, with his sons, his wife, and a nephew. This way, people in the area can enjoy his coffee, as the majority of his production is exported.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants for his farm.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene de 40 años vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 12 a 21 años. Ella vivió en Bogotá la capital de Colombia y allí emprendió un negocio, a través del cual se dedicó a mejorar la imagen personal y profesional de damas, caballeros y niños, mediante técnicas de belleza que aplica en un pequeño salón de belleza ubicado en el lugar donde habitaba; pero como ha estado enamorada de la Costa Caribe de Colombia, por sus playas, brisas, mar y calidez de su gente, se trasladó hace 12 años, a la ciudad de Barranquilla donde emprendió esta misma actividad y ubicó su negocio en la primera planta donde reside e instaló a su familia en el segundo piso, en condiciones de arrendamiento. Su meta es lograr adecuar un local amplio y bien organizado para brindar un ambiente confortable a su clientela y tener su propia vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer Credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace sala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos de peluquería y hará adecuaciones físicas al local donde esta funcionando. Su razón de éxito en esta inversión radica en que tendrá un capital con el cual comprar en mayor volumen, ganar descuentos y también a la gran experiencia que tienen Marlene en el manejo de este negocio, con lo cual provisionara un ambiente agradable a su clientela a quienes impactará con un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Marlene, age 40, lives with her husband and three children, who are between the ages of 12 and 21.  She lived in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia, and that is where she began her business.  Through her business she devoted herself to improving the personal and professional images of women, men, and children.  She did this by using beauty techniques in a small beauty salon in her house.

However, as she had been in love with the Carribean coast of Colombia because of its beaches, breezes, sea, and the warmth of its people, she moved to the city of Barranquilla 12 years ago.  That is where she began the same business activity on the first floor of her residence.  She set her family up on the second floor, which they rented.

Her goal is to manage to adapt an ample place that is well organized in order to provide a comfortable atmosphere for her customers and to have her own home.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan.  It is also her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy hairdressing supplies and to make physical adaptations to the place where she is working.  

Her reason for being successful with this investment stems from having money to buy in greater volume and get discounts.  Also, Marlene has a lot of experience running this business.  She will use this experience to provide a pleasant atmosphere for her customers, and she will impress them with her good service.

loans.use: buy hairdressing supplies and to make physical adaptations to the place where she is working.

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es: La Sra. Marleni es conviviente  tiene 2 hijos, Marleni  es socia  del grupo “Los Capullitos”, grupo conformado por 9  integrantes que se dedica a diversas actividades de comercio. Marleni se dedica a la venta de abarrotes  que está  situado en su casa este negocio surge con la idea de obtener mejores ingresos económicos  gracias a sus esfuerzo y  dedicación a  logrado mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sus hijos tienen educacion y esta por comprarse una casa, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar abarrotes ( Arroz, Fideos, Leche. Marleni cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Marleni has two children and lives with her common-law husband.  She is a member of the group “Los Capullitos”, which is comprised of nine individuals who have various businesses.  She sells groceries from her home.  She started this business with the aim of obtaining better income.  Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has been able to improve her family's quality of life, and her children are getting an education.

She is about to buy a new house, with the goal of continuing to grow her business.  She is seeking a new loan to buy items for resalse (rice, beans and milk).  With a lot of hard work and effort, she will reach her goals. The loans from Edaprospo will help her in this.

loans.use: to buy items for resale (rice, beans and milk).

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a married woman. She has a son who is 25 years old. She describes herself as being a focused woman. She operates a butchery shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located at a fast-growing market, and her primary customers are customers within the market and the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cow and goat. Her business goal is to run another butcher shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a piece of land with the profits that will be generated from her business.

loans.use: to buy cow and goat meat

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es: Carlos compró con su anterior credikiva materiales como resina broches, estampas entre otros y elaboró hermosas artesanias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará una caneca de resinas, conos de hilo entre otros insumos decorativos. Su inversión será un éxito porque atenderá la demanda de un pedido de 800 rosarios, 1500 llaveros y 100 manillas. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Les agradezco mucho porque me sirvió mucho el crédito y me ha generado ganacias."
texts.en: With his previous loan from Kiva, Carlos bought materials such as resins, brooches, stamps and more, with which he made beautiful crafts.  Currently he is seeking a loan with which he will buy a bottle of resin, spools of thread, and other decorative materials.  His investment will be successful because he will be able to fulfill an order for 800 rosaries, 1500 keychains and 100 bracelets.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following: "I thank you all very much because this loan has served me very well and has brought me income."

loans.use: to buy a bottle of resin, spools of thread, and other decorative materials.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Zainabu has been operating a food stall for the past six years and she aspires to opening a hotel in the future. She describes food and school fees to be her greatest monthly expenses, and price fluctuation of goods to be her major challenge. She sells her goods at the market centre to the general public. 

The loan of 30,000 KES will enable her to purchase beans, sugar, rice and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, rice and cooking fat

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old. She is married to Peter and together they have five children. She sells secondhand clothes besides being a farmer. She has been in the business for the past five years.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of her friends who is a KADET client. This will be her fifth loan from KADET Ltd. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She will use the whole amount to purchase clothes for sale in her business.

She hopes to own a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to add more stock of clothes

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single lady who sells foodstuffs at the market and she has been doing so for the past four years. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Asha dreams of opening a café in future.

She joined Yehu because they care for their clients. Food is her greatest monthly expense. High price of commodities is her major challenge.

She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy wheat flour, cooking fat and baking powder.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking fat and baking powder

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 33 years old. He is married to Beth and together they have three children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He was introduced by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to purchase manure, seedlings and pesticides for use on his farm.

He hopes to own a retail shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy manure, seedlings and pesticides for use on his farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire « Sarepta », est un entrepreneur dynamique, infatigable,  âgée de 40 ans, mère de 8 jeunes enfants, femme divorcée. Elle est  vendeuse de petits objets précieux et de maquillage (bijoux, chainette, gourmette, bagues, rouge a lèvres, font de teint, mèches, etc.). Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la rue, alors au point de vente stratégique pour attirer la curiosité du public  particulièrement les dames congolaises acquises au nouveau style de la modernité et la mondialisation. Elle commença son business avec son fonds propre reçu d’un membre de sa famille. Il y a 4 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  8  cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  des petits objets (bijoux, chainette, gourmette, bagues, rouge a lèvres, font de teint, mèches, etc.) à marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  ouvrir un grand magasin de référence dans la ville de Goma et  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes pour leur émancipation économique et financière.
texts.en: This client is the leader of the Sarepta business group. She is a dynamic, indefatigable entrepreneur 40 years of age. She is divorced and the mother of eight young children. She sells small gift items and cosmetics (jewelry, necklaces, chain bracelets, rings, lipstick, makeup base, hair extensions). She sets up her wares on the street, selecting a strategic location to attract the attention of customers, particularly Congolese women used to the contemporary global fashions. She launched her business with her own capital received from a relative. She has been earning income in this way for four years. She just finished eight loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan will allow her to stock up on miscellaneous small items (jewelry, necklaces, chain bracelets, rings, lipstick, makeup base, hair extensions etc) for resale. In addition, she would like to open a major store in the city of Goma and to see her children grow up in comfortable conditions. This client thanks Hekima for its action dedicated to helping impoverished women gain their economic and financial independence..

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous small items (jewelry, necklaces, chain bracelets, rings, lipstick, makeup base, hair extensions etc) for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes es madre de dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 21 años. Ella trabaja para una familia y poco a poco ha logrado ir adquiriendo todo con lo que hoy cuenta,pues tiene su vivienda propia, ubicada en el macroproyecto de vivienda sostenible,  "Villas de San Pablo", en la ciudad de Barranquilla, liderado por la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Ella los fines de semas trabaja en su propio negocio en actividades comerciales, vendiendo productos cosméticos, colonias, cremas y ropa de marcas importadas. Esta mercancia que compra en la ciudad, es provenientes de Estados Unidos y de Panamá y las distribuye en el conjunto residencial en sus tiempos libres, así mismo vende a crédito pidiendo una cuota inicial y el saldo lo financia a plazos no mayores e 45 dias. Como sus ventas se incrementan en temporadas especiales, muchas veces su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para cubrir la demanda de estas épocas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará splash, perfumes, ropa, sandalias etc, aprovechando un importante pedido que tiene, para responder al dia de las madres, fecha en la cual quiere hacer su mejor venta del año.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a mother of two children aged 18 and 21 years.  She works for a family and little by little has managed to save up and buy her own home, situated in the project of sustainable living "Villas de San Pablo", in the city of Barranquilla, founded by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

On the weekends, she works in her own business, selling perfumes and other cosmetics, creams and imported clothing.   She buys this merchandise in the city, and it comes from the United States and Panama.  She sells these items in her area in her free time.  She is seeking a loan to build her inventory, and she will repay it within 45 days.

Since her sales increase at certain times of year, often her working captial is not sufficient to cover her customers' demand during these periods.  This is the reason she is seeking a Kiva loan, her first through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan she will buy perfumes and other cosmetics, clothes, sandals and other items.  She is taking advantage of an important opportunity to respond to Mother's Day, the date on which she hopes to make her best sales of the year.

loans.use: to buy perfume, soap, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 31 years old. She is married to Wilberforce and together they have three children. She sells secondhand clothes and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 18,000 from the business.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD, after she was introduced by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase more stock of clothes for resale in her business.

She hopes to own a boutique in the near future so as to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Thomas Mwai

texts.en:
Thomas has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. He is 47 years old, married to Mary, and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Thomas hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela es una mujer  de 53 años de edad, de estado civil casada, sin hijos a su cargo, es decir todos son mayores de edad. Viven en casa propia con su cónyuge, en el caserío El Carmen distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura. Además solo cuentan con el servicio básico de Energía Eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen  a través de norias artesanales; bajo estas condiciones viven la mayoría de familias.

La actividad principal que desarrolla Ángela  es  la crianza/venta de ovinos (tiene 12 animales), esta crianza lo realiza en corrales en la parte posterior de su casa, donde los alimenta a base de concentrado y pastos naturales;   también prepara  chicha de jora, piqueos. Ángela cuenta con bastante experiencia en este tipo de negocio, donde sus animales los vende a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona. Su cónyuge también se dedica a la fabricación de algarrobina donde le permite tener otros ingresos adicionales, es decir ambos se apoyan mutuamente.

Ángela ha solicitado un crédito por S/.1700 nuevos soles, y  será para la compra de alimentos balanceado para sus animales y mejoras en el corral de los mismos; de esta forma ira incrementando su capital de trabajo y mejora de calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ángela is a 53-year-old married woman with no children in her care (that is, they are all adults).  She lives in her own house with her husband in the hamlet of El Carmen, district of Tambogrande, department of Piura.  In addition, they only have basic electricity and they get their water from a handmade waterwheel.  The majority of the families lives under these conditions.

Ángela's main work is raising and selling sheep (she has 12 animals).  She does this rearing in corrals in back of her house, where she feeds them concentrated feed and natural grasses.  She also makes "Chica de jora" [drink made of fermented corn] and skewered meat.  Ángela has a lot of experience in this type of business, selling her animals to the wholesale vendors in the area.  Her husband also works making syrup from the black carob tree, which allows them to have additional income.  In other words, the two support each other mutually.

Ángela has requested a loan of 1700 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy balanced feed for her animals and to make improvements to the corral.  In this way she will continue to increase her working capital and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and to make improvements to the corrals.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 31-year-old mother of three children between the ages of three and ten years, all enrolled in school. She is married to Martin, a driver. She has been operating a poultry business for the past six years, and she also owns some rental houses. Catherine sells her products from home to hotel operators. She dreams of hiring an employee in the future to assist her in the day-to-day operations. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Catherine joined Yehu to get access to loans for expanding her businesses. The loan of 30,000 KES will enable her to purchase chicken feed and renovate her rental house.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and renovate her rental house.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is a 20-year-old married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 3 years old. Her husband works as a driver.

Genalyn buys and sells firewood to her community. She earns 1500 PHP per month with this business. Genalyn is also an AVON dealer. She works hard to improve her earnings and support her family. She requested a loan to buy more firewood to sell. Genalyn hopes to have a stable business. She also hopes to save for her children's education and improve their house.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 43 años de edad compró con su credikiva, materias primas, productos alimenticios e hizo adecuaciones a un baño y compró un congelador. En la actualidad invertirá su crédito en la compra de productos de miscelanea,para generar nuesvas oportunidades de compra a sus clientes y materias primas en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos, que le mejores su nivel competitivo e incrementen sus ventas. "Le agradezco la confianza y el apoyo espero seguir creciendo con su ayuda. Gracias."
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old, and with her credikiva loan she bought ingredients and food products, made improvements to a bathroom, and bought a freezer.

Now she will use her loan to purchase miscellaneous goods, in order to generate new buying opportunities for her customers, as well as to purchase ingredients in bulk, in order to earn discounts that improve her competitive position and increase her sales. 

"I appreciate the trust and support and I hope to continue growing with your help. Thank you."

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous goods to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana lives in a small village of Khobi District, West Georgia. She is 46 years old and lives with her husband,Temur, two daughters (22 and 19 years old) and a 17 year-old son who goes to school. 

Nana is a director of a local school. She gets a monthly salary. She is quite busy in her main job, but still finds time to be involved in the family farm, led by Temur. They have a dairy farm with 2 milk cows and 2 calves. Temur produces cheese and sells on average 40 kg of this product per month. Along with the above-mentioned activities, they own 1.2 hectares of land, where maize and bay trees are grown. Nana and Temur sell harvested maize and bay leaves at the local market to wholesalers. Total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris.

Nana requested a loan for expansion of the dairy farm. She will purchase an additional milk cow, which will allow the family to produce and sell 50% more cheese. The monthly income of the family will increase by at least 150 Laris, which will means a large increase. Nana plans to use the increased income for financing  the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en: Peregrina is a 39-year-old married woman with 3 children ages 2, 4 and 6. Her husband works as a farmer. Peregrina also works at their farm and helps her husband grow rice crops to sell. She also sells firewood to her community. Peregrina does her best to help sustain her family. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and more firewood to sell. She hopes to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more firewood to sell

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a married man with six children between the ages of eight and 24. 

Bernardo sells coconut wine and vinegar to his community. He started this business three years ago. Bernardo works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school. He plans to start raising hogs to augment his income. He applied for a loan to buy piglets to raise and more coconut wine and vinegar to sell. Bernardo hopes to have more capital for his businesses.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and more coconut wine and vinegar to sell

loans.name: Okumu

texts.en:
Tom is a single man. He describes himself as diligent and strong-minded about his business.Tom has a passion for selling milk, a business he was involved in earlier on. However, he decided to operate a retail shop and sells items such as flour, milk, knitting wool, sodas, milk, sugar, etc. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs one staff member. Tom's business is located in a residential area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as having inadequate funds for expanding his business. 

Tom will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy a fridge for storing milk for selling. His business goal is to run a milk supply company within five years. He hopes that in the future he will double his income from his business.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for the storage of milk.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 24 year-old man and is married to Veronica.   They have a one year-old child.

Stephen has been selling  bricks for the last two years and makes a monthly income of KES. 11,500. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD., with which he will buy more bricks for sale. 

His profits will be used to expand the business. His dream is to expand and have a big business.

loans.use: To buy more bricks for sale.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a father of four children between the ages of five and fourteen years, all of whom are in school. He lives in his own house that has both electricity and piped water. Alfred has been operating a bar for the last 10 years. Other sources of livelihood include income from his rental houses. He aspires to hire more employees in the future, and he describes food and school fees to be his greatest monthly expenses. High transport costs are his major challenge.
With the loan of Ksh 50000, he plans to purchase crates of beer to sell.

loans.use: to purchase crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Geneviv

texts.en:
Geneviv is a  28 year-old lady and is married to Collins.  They have two children, aged four and six years.  Geneviv runs a beauty salon, a business she has been doing for the last five years.  She makes a monthly income of KES.13,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, with which she will buy hair chemicals and wigs. She will use her profits to grow the business. Her dream is to successfully have a big business.

loans.use: To buy hair  chemicals and wigs.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 33 year-old man from Homabay town and is married to Anna.  They have two children, aged 11 and 5 years.

James operates a sugarcane business, which he has done for the last three years.  He makes a monthly income of KES. 9,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, with which he will buy more sugarcane for sale. His increased income will be used to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugarcane.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is from a village of Samegrelo Region. She lives in a small village with her husband, Elguja, a 13 year-old daughter, an 11 year-old son, and her parents-in-law.  The children go to school. Elguja works as a mechanical engineer on a local TV tower. Nani is leading the agricultural business of the family. In particular, she runs a family owned farm with 2 milk cows, 4 calves and a pig. Nani produces on average 40 kg of cheese per month. She sells cheese and piglets (on average 10 piglets per year) on the open market of the nearby town. Along with the above mentioned, the family owns 1 hectare of agricultural land.  Elguja and Nani grow maize on this plot. About half of the harvested corn is used by the family for feeding the domestic animals, and the rest is sold locally. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Nani requested a loan for purchasing an additional milk cow. She will get more milk and will be able to increase production and sales of cheese by 50%. It will have a positive impact on the family income. Nani plans to use the increased income for improving the living conditions of the family, especially the children.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Mwawira

texts.en:
Mwawira is a 55 year-old man with nine children, three of whom are in school. He owns a video shop which is located at the market. He has been in this business for the past 15 years and he dreams of opening a shop in future. Mwawira lives in his own house that has both electricity and piped water. He describes food and school fees to be his major challenge. He joined Yehu to get loans to boost his business. 
The loan of Ksh 50,000 will enable him to purchase some filming materials.

loans.use: to purchase some filming materials.

loans.name: Gulnazi

texts.en:
Gulnazi is 49 years old. She lives in a West Georgian village, in Senaki District. Gulnazi is married and lives with her family: husband Seriozha, two sons, a daughter-in-law, two grandsons and mother-in-law. Gulnazi, Seriozha and their sons are involved in a family agricultural business. They have three milk cows and three milk buffaloes on their farm. Each evening, Gulnazi milks the cows and buffaloes. In the mornings, she makes traditional West Georgian cheese and sells, on average, 90 kg of this product per month on the Senaki open market. Along with the above-mentioned, the family has two hectares of land, where maize is grown. The family is busy with the farm all day, especially during the spring and summer seasons. The family's total average monthly income is 700 Laris, including the pension of Gulnazi’s mother-in-law. 

Gulnazi requested credit for renting a tractor for tilling the land. Also, she will use part of the credit to purchase fuel for the tractor. After tilling the land, they will sow maize. Gulnazi’s sons will work hard during the whole spring and summer to get a good harvest to sell at a reasonable price. The family will use the profits for financing family daily needs.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for tilling the land and to purchase fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Serrana

texts.en:
Serrana is 40 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is single and has two children ages 5 and 13, who live at home and are in school. Serrana stopped her own education in the 8th grade.

She received a little money from her friend to start a business and has been in business for 15 years. She enjoys the flow of her customers and is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter ball, okra, pepper, rice, and oil to sell. Her dream is to become a homeowner and see her children go to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball, okra, pepper, rice, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.en:
Valerio is a 61-year-old married man from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. He makes "tuba" (coconut wine) to sell to his community. Valerio has been making and selling tuba for 10 years. He earns about 6,000 PHP per month with his business. 

He plans to use his loan to purchase containers and food coloring. Valerio hopes for his business to grow so he can make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase containers and food coloring for his business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a 34-year-old married woman with 4 children ages 6, 7, 9 and 14. She makes native baskets made of rattan. She earns 2000 PHP per month with this business. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale. Elena works hard to help provide for her family's daily needs and sustain her children's education. She plans to use her loan to purchase weaving materials and pig feed. Elena hopes for her family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials and pig feed

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: 59-year-old Teodora is a hog raiser from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She has had this business for 7 years and earns 3000 PHP per month. Aside from raising hogs, she also sells food items like rice cakes to her community. She does her best to assist her husband in providing for their family's needs. She applied for a loan to purchase piglets and feed. Teodora hopes for her family to have a more stable living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 66 years old, married and has six children. He sells water to earn a living and has engaged in the business for over ten years. Joseph also owns rental houses that earn him extra income.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joseph has gained knowledge about business management and has been able to access financial resources easily. Joseph hopes to grow his business in the future. He has requested for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy a water tank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita earns a living selling ready-to-wear clothes to her community. She sells men and women's shirts, jeans and kids' clothes. She earns 10000 PHP per month with her business. 

Carmelita works hard to improve her business and support her family. She has 4 children and 3 of them still go to school.

Carmelita is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She hopes this loan will help improve her sales and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a farmer from San Jose, Talibon. She is a married woman with children. Imelda has been growing and selling rice for 15 years. She earns 4000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Imelda requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest. 

In the future, Imelda hopes for her family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en: Primitiva is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She works hard to keep her farm productive. She is able to buy her family's basic needs with her income. She applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers. Primitiva hopes to have an abundant harvest. In the future, she hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Elmaddin

texts.ru: Elmaddin 31 qod. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Elmaddin uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. On jivet v Fizuli regione gde bolshe vsego razvito skatovodstvo i bolshe svego yest nujda v razviti etogo biznessa. Elmaddin yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fizuli goroda. Elmaddin seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit bolshe korov dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa, tak kak yest ochen bolshoy spros sredi pokupateley. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego dedushki kotoriy toje zanimalsya skotovodstvom.
texts.en: Elmaddin is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. For the last four years, he has been involved in animal farming, raising cattle. He lives in the Fuzuli Region, where  raising livestock is the most common type of business as the need for it is high. Elmaddin is an Internally Displaced Person from the town of Fuzuli. At present, Elmaddin needs AZN in order to buy more cattle for the development of his business as customer demand is very high. Elmaddin learned this line of work from his grandfather, who also used to raise livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Kadongo

texts.en:
Kadongo is a father of five children, four of whom are enrolled in school. He operates a retail shop and has been doing so for the past ten years. His primary customers are the local residents.

He aspires to expand his shop to a wholesale operation in the future, and he describes food and school fees as his greatest monthly expenses. Kadongo lives in his own house that has electricity but no piped water. High market competition is his major challenge. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES, he will be able to add stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to add stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.en:
Braulio is 23 years old.  He is a married man living in Talibon, Bohol. He has no children yet. Braulio is a farmer and started growing rice five years ago. Part of his harvest is for family consumption, and the rest he sells to his community. Braulio works hard to build his own family and save for their future.

Braulio is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farming supplies. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farming supplies

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa sells soap at Akotokyire near Abura. She has been selling soap for 30 years now. Her husband has gone on retirement. She has 4 children who are in school. Yaa uses her income to help her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She needs this loan to purchase boxes of soap to sell. With the new profit, Yaa will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase boxes of soap to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married to a civil servant at university of Cape Coast Ghana. They are blessed with 2 children. Ekua sells plastic bowls at Akotokyire. She uses her income to help her husband to feed their children. Ekua will use her loan to purchase more plastic bowls to sell. Ekua will use her new profit to acquire a shop for the sale of her plastic bowls.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls to sell

loans.name: Fenda

texts.en:
Fenda is 42 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is married and has six children between the ages of 10 and 28 years. They are in school and live at home. Fenda did not go to school. 

For the past 25 years, she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her friends. 

Fenda is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She enjoys her business. With her daily profit, she plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Djromahouton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJROMAHOUTON est composé de trois personnes qui exercent les mêmes activités génératrices de revenus.  C'est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Cyanath Anne Claire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Cyanath Anne Claire est âgée de 54 ans et vit au Bénin. Cyanath Anne Claire a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Cyanath Anne Claire est mariée à un certain Ismaël. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Cyanath Anne Claire vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Cyanath Anne Claire vend depuis une dizaine d’année, divers articles (habits d'enfants et autres) par le système de distribution. Cyanath Anne Claire s’approvisionne au Benin et parfois à Lomé. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Cyanath Anne Claire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHOUTON, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Djromahouton group is composed of three individuals working in the same line of business. This is the sixth time that the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to expand its business. The group’s representative, by the name of Cyanath Anne Claire, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Cyanath Anne Claire is 54 years old and lives in Benin. She stopped going to school at the primary level. Her husband’s name is Ismael. They have three dependent children, all in school. Cyanath Anne Claire lives together with her husband and children and provides for the various family needs jointly with her husband. In order to make a living, for about a dozen years Cyanath Anne Claire has been selling various items (children’s clothing, etc) through a distribution system. She stocks up in Benin and sometimes in Lomé. With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her revenues, Cyanath Anne Claire, together   with the other members of the Djromahouton group, is seeking her sixth loan from ALIDé. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy various articles and children's clothing [for resale].

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with eight children aged between 12 and 30 years. Five of her children are school-aged.

Leonora works as a farmer in Trinidad, Bohol. She grows rice crops to sell. She does her best to grow her crops healthy. She also sells rice cakes and banana cue to her community. She does her best to support her husband in providing for their needs and sending their children to school. She has applied for a loan to purchase farm fertilizers and food ingredients. She hopes to be able to have her children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizers and food ingredients

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia is a baker. She bakes cakes and bread to sell, which she has been doing for 12 years now. She is a single parent with one child. Emilia uses her income to pay for her child’s school fees. Emilia will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her bakery. With her profit, she will buy another oven to make her work easier.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her bakery

loans.name: Ma. Emma

texts.en:
Ma. Emma runs a sari-sari store, or convenience store, in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 38 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband works as a driver.

Ma. Emma started her sari-sari store 3 years ago. She sells various items like coffee, sugar, canned goods and toiletries. Each month, Ma. Emma earns 6,000 PHP from her business. She works hard to save for her children's education.

Ma. Emma is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as canned goods. This will help increase her sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as canned goods.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa produces kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) for sale in Akotokyire near Abura. She has been selling kenkey for three years. 

Adjoa is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a security officer. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in caring for their children. 

She needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Adjoa wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Fe En Cristo Group

texts.es:
Tatiana es la tesorera de Banco Mujer Fe en Cristo, es un grupo con una amplia trayectoria, está joven mujer de 26 años, y madre de dos niños, con quienes vive, junto a su compañero. 
Está señora es muy trabajadora, además de tener su microempresa junto a su marido, también trabaja en la Municipalidad de Talamanca, como oficinista, tomo este trabajo ya que los ingresos que generan los cultivos de plátano no eran suficientes para cubrir los gastos familiares, por ello decidieron que fuera ella quien trabajara fuera de la casa, ya que tenía más facilidad de conseguir empleo, gracias a que concluyo sus estudios de secundaria, además de tener algunos cursos de computación. Así que Tatiana cuando regresa del trabaja, días feriado ó fines de semana, es cuando atiende lo referente a sus cultivos, y cuando ella no está quien ve por la finca es su marido. 
Este es el tercer crédito que solicita y tanto este como los anteriores han sido de mucha ayuda, ya que les permite invertir en insumos para la siembra de dicho cultivo. 
Junto a Tatiana hay una socia más, que también va a invertir en agricultura
texts.en:
Tatiana is the treasurer for Banco Mujer Fe en Cristo [Faith in Christ communal bank], a group with an extensive history. This young woman, 26, is a mother of two children whom she lives with along with her spouse. 
. 
She is a very hard working woman.  In addition to having a micro business with her husband, she also works for the canton of Talamanca as an office worker.  She took this job since the income generated from their banana crop was not sufficient to cover family expenses.  Therefore, they decided she would work outside the home since it was easier for her to get a job thanks to having completed her high school education as well as some computer courses.  Tatiana tends to her crop business when she returns from work, during holidays, or on weekends.  When she is not there, her husband looks after the farm.  

This is the third loan that she is requesting.  This loan and the ones before it have been a great help because they allow her to invest in supplies to sow her crop.  

There is one more member in addition to Tatiana who will also invest in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sow her banana crop.

loans.name: Jazmin Estela

texts.es: Jazmín inicio su negocio venta de productos por catalogo hace 6 años, lo empezó como una manera de ver reflejados ingresos para ayudarse en la economía de su hogar. Le va bien y sobre todo le da tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos en la casa y no tener que enviarlos a la guardería. El trabajo lo realiza sola de lunes a domingo sin horario definido. Jazmín nos cuenta que el negocio es rentable pero a veces se a quedado sin capital ya que en ciertas ocasiones no le pagan por lo que tiene que conseguirlo para cubrir sus deudas. Su esposo es vendedor automotriz y es la persona que mantiene el hogar pero de esta manera ella le ayuda con los gastos. Tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 3 años de edad. Con el crédito va a comprar productos para tener en stock como maquillaje, perfume, cremas. Su meta próxima si Dios lo permite es continuar trabajando con Avon para mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en: Jazmín started her business of selling catalog products six years ago.  She started it as a way of seeing helpful income reflected in her home economy.  It is going well, and above all, it gives her time to take care of her children at home and not have to send them to daycare.  She works from Monday to Sunday, but without a fixed schedule.  Jazmín tells us that the business is profitable but at times, she has been without capital since on certain occasions, she doesn't get paid and she has to obtain it (capital) to cover her debts.  Her husband is an auto salesman and is the person who maintains the home, but in this way, she helps him with the expenses.  She has 2 children, ages 14 and 3.  With the loan, she is going to purchase products to have in stock such as make-up, perfume, and creams.  Her next goal, if God permits, is to continue working with Avon in order to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase make-up, perfume, and creams.

loans.name: Maame Aba

texts.en: Maame Aba sells cloth at Akotokyir near Abura.  She is married and has two children.  Her husband is a driver. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. Maame Aba will use her loan to purchase different kinds of cloth to satisfy her customers. With her profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of cloth to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba sells fabric and cloth in Akotokyire, near Abura. She has been in this business for the past twenty-five years. 

Araba is a single parent and has four children. She feeds and clothes her children and pays for their fees with her income. 

She will use her loan to purchase more fabrics and cloth for sale. With the new profit, Araba will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and cloth for sale.

loans.name: Cristo Me Ama 1,  2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Cristo Me Ama (Christ Loves Me) 1, 2, 3. As a single mother, she makes her home in a simple structure with her three children. To earn a living, she operates a gasoline sales business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying fuel and motor oil. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy attending church and to earn an income.

Maria is excited to be receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza. She has had her business for about five years, and she started it with her savings. She has been saving her profits and reinvesting in her business. She is a very hard-working woman, and she says that she has worked as long as she can remember. She was a child when she started working and helping her family. Now she is very proud to provide for her children, so they can attend school.

Maria's group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where sugarcane and tourism dominate the economy. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy gasoline and motor oil to sell.

loans.name: Yuri Anis

texts.es: La joven Yuris , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su mamá , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , construyendo su casita donde pueda habitar dignamente , Yuris con sus tres prestamos anteriores logro mejorar su negocio ya que ahora se sostiene así mismo con los ingresos de ventas diarias ; ahora Yuris necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción , como bloques , arena, cemento , piedrín ,hierro , entre otros .Agradece enormemente los préstamos otorgados ya que para ella le han cambiado la vida , siendo aun muy joven tiene muchas ganas de prosperidad y sobre todo darle una mejor vida a su mamá ya que juntas luchan día a día para su bienestar .
texts.en: Yuris resides in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her mother.  She has plans to improve her family's living conditions, building a small house where they could live with dignity.  With her 3 previous loans, Yuris managed to improve her business, and now it is generating daily sales.  Now Yuris needs a loan to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, sand, cement, gravel, iron and other items.  She greatly appreciates the loans that she has been granted, because they've changed her life.  As she is still very young, she has a strong desire to prosper and, most of all, provide a better life for her mother, because together they struggle each day for their well-being.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Una Oportunidad Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Una oportunidad esta compuesto por tres integrantes dos mujeres y un varón, la encargada del grupo es la Sra. Juana la Sra. de  pollera) tiene 49 años y es casada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 32, 29 y 24, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado en su puesto que se encuentra ubicado en uno de los mercados de la localidad de Sacaba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la  institución, la Sra. Juana  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de pescado por mayor para poder vender en su puesto de venta,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir mercadería, la Sra. Juana  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las altas y bajas en las ventas y  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando sus productos  y de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Juana se siente agradecida por resta oportunidad que le dan a ella y a sus compañeros de grupo.
texts.en: The communal bank "Una Oportunidad" is made up of 3 women and one man.  The head of the group is Juana (the woman in the skirt).  She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 32, 29 and 24.  She has a business selling fish from a stall in one of the markets in the town of Sacaba.  This is the first loan that she has taken from the institution.  Juana is going to use this loan to buy fish at wholesale to sell from her stall.  The reason she is requesting this loan is that she doesn't have enough money to acquire merchandise to sell.  Juana faces challenges in her business, including the ups and downs in sales.  She will use the profits to continue buying her products, so that in this way she can increase her working capital.  Juana feels grateful for this opportunity that she and her fellow group members are being given.

loans.use: to buy fish at wholesale

loans.name: Ola Oluwa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLA OLUWA est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mariam est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mariam est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Mariam n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mariam est mariée à un marchand du nom de Mounirou. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mariam vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin faire face à ses diverses charges, Mariam vend depuis quatre ans, des ustensiles de cuisine (assiettes, glacières, etc.). Mariam vend aussi de façon parallèle, des chaussures dans un marché du Benin. Mariam s’approvisionne à Lomé. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mariam sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du  groupe OLA OLUWA, un deuxiéme crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The OLA OLUWA group consists of three women who are friends and who belong to the same savings group.  The group's representative, Mariam, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.

Mariam is 38 years old and lives in Benin.  She never went to school.  She is married to a merchant named Mounirou.  Mariam and her husband have three children, all in school and all their dependents.  The couple jointly takes care of the household expenses.  In order to cover her various expenses, Mariam has been selling kitchen utensils (plates, ice boxes, etc.) for the past four years.  Additionally, she also sells shoes at a market in Benin.  She buys her goods in Lomé.

Eager to satisfy her customers' needs, and in order to increase her turnover and income, Mariam is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the OLA OLUWA group.  The first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils (plates and ice boxes).

loans.name: Wangninan 9 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAN 9 est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Thakiratou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Thakiratou est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Thakiratou est mariée à un maçon du nom de Tessilimou. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge et tous scolarisés. Thakiratou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Thakiratou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Thakiratou vend depuis une dizaine d'année, des vêtements (shirts, tee- shirts) et des ustensiles de cuisine (assiettes et glacières) à son domicile. Thakiratou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Thakiratou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAN 9, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et de se faire assez de marges bénéficiaires. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The WANGNINAN 9 group consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood.  It is the fifth time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to increase its level of activity.  The group's representative, Thakiratou, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.

Thakiratou is 35 years old and lives in Benin.  She is married to a mason named Tessilimou.  Thakiratou and her husband have four children, all in school and all their dependents.  Thakiratou never attended school.  She lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.

In order to meet her various needs, Thakiratou has been selling clothes (shirts, T-shirts) and kitchen utensils (plates and ice boxes) from her home, for about ten years.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

Eager to satisfy her customers' needs, and in order to increase her turnover and income, Thakiratou is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the WANGNINAN 9 group.  This loan will allow them to increase the level of their activity and to get adequate profit margins.  Their previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy clothes and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es: El señor Jorge , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa , la cual labora como comerciante para apoyarle con  los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es poder ir poco a poco mejorando las condiciones de vida , agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos Kiva  ya que con los tres prestamos anteriores le han servido para realizar el muro de su vivienda , ahora quiere hacer un cuarto en la parte trasera para uno de sus hijos , ya que va mas grandecito y necesita de privacidad , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con suficientes ingresos económicos para realizar la obra de una sola vez .El préstamo lo necesita para comprar bloques , cemento , arena , piedrín , hierro , estribos , alambre , etc.
texts.en: Jorge is a resident of the municipality of Ticuantepe along with his wife who works as a shopkeeper to support him with the household expenses. His plans for the family are to be able to go about improving their living conditions little by little. He is thankful for the trust that Afodenic has given him by means of the Kiva loans as the three previous loans allowed him to construct a wall for his home. Now he would like to build a room in the back part of his home for one of his children since he is getting older and needs more privacy. The greatest problem he has is not having sufficient financial income in order to complete the project at one time. He needs the loan to buy blocks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, buttresses, wire, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Edwin Milton

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin tiene 48 años y es casado con un hijo de la edad de seis años, el se dedica al servicio de amplificación animando distintos acontecimientos sociales como bautizos matrimonios fiestas de quince años y distintas actividades sociales este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Edwin utilizara  este préstamo para compra de un equipo de computación para seguir equipando su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejora de tecnología en su actividad, el Sr. Edwin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la gran cantidad de competencia en el rubro, pero sigue adelante  ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia, el va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando la tecnología en cuanto a amplificadores, su deseo para su negocio es tener una orquesta propia ya que también quiere incursionar en la música pero eso en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en: Edwin is 48 years old, and is married with one son who is six years old.  He works providing amplification for social events such as baptisms, weddings and fifteenth- birthday parties and other social acitivities.  This loan is his first with the organization.  Edwin will use the loan to buy a computer system to continue equiping his business.  His reason for requesting this loan is to improve the technology in his business acitivity.  Edwin is encountering challenges in his business due to the large amount of competition in the field.  Howver, he carries on, as this is the only activity with which he supports his family.  He will use the benefits to continue improving his technology such as with amplifiers.  His wish for his business is to have a proper orchestra as he also wants to branch out into music in the not-too-distant future.

loans.use: to buy a computer system.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is a trader.  She sells raw rice, beans, groundnut and gari at Akotokyire near Abura. She is married to an accountant and has 2 children. She uses her income to assists her husband to pay their utility bills. Hawa needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans, groundnut and gari to sell. With the new profit, Hawa will expand her business.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, groundnut and gari to sell

loans.name: Ma. Venessa

texts.en: Ma. Venessa is a 26-year-old married woman with 2 children. She sells barbecue for a living. She also sells "halo-halo" (shaved ice with various sweets) and hot cakes in the daytime.  Ma. Venessa is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients such as pork and chicken meat. She hopes to open a sari-sari store in the future. S he also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: buy pork and chicken to make food to sell

loans.name: Liliana Isabel
