texts.es: Liliana con su credikiva anterior compró medicina natural y otros productos de laboratorios naturales , así mismo compró otro tipo de mercancia como ropa y bolsos que vendió y con la cual ganó un npoco mas de dinero. En la actualidad planea su segundo finaciamiento con el cual comprará mercancia variadas, para responder a los pedidos del dia de la madre que generan una rotación rápida de inventarios, con su credikiva tambien hará mejoras locativas para que ella y sus clientes se sientan mas agusto en sus instalaciones y regresen.
texts.en: With her previous loan, Liliana purchased natural medicine and other products from natural laboratories. She also bought other types of merchandise, like clothing and handbags, which she sold, thereby earning a little more money. She is currently requesting her second loan to purchase various merchandise in response to the Mother's Day orders that create a rapid turnover of inventory. She will also use her loan to make improvements to her shop so that she and her customers will feel more comfortable in her facility and come back.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise and also to make improvements to her business location.

loans.name: Egbe Irere Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EGBE IRERE est composé de trois personnes qui appartiennent au même groupe de tontine et ayant les mêmes affinités parentales. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Aminatou Olayitan est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Aminatou Olayitan est âgée de 49 ans et vit au Bénin. Aminatou Olayitan a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Aminatou Olayitan est mariée à un plombier du nom de Anselme. Le couple a deux enfants scolarisés et à leur charge. Aminatou Olayitan vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin de faire face à ses besoins, Aminatou Olayitan vend depuis huit ans du maïs, du mil dans une boutique au Bénin. De façon secondaire, Aminatou Olayitan vend des bois de chauffage et des assiettes. Aminatou Olayitan s’approvisionne dans le nord du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Aminatou Olayitan sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EGBE IRERE, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The EGBE IRERE group consists of three women who belong to the same savings group and share family ties. The group's representative, Aminatou Olayitan, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.

Aminatou Olayitan is 49 years old and lives in Benin. She left school at the elementary level.  She is married to a plumber named Anselme. The couple has two children, both in school and their dependents. Aminatou Olayitan lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.

In order to meet her various needs, Aminatou Olayitan has been selling maize and millet in a shop in Benin for the past eight years. Additionally she also sells firewood and plates.  She buys her goods in the north of Benin.

Eager to satisfy her customers' needs, and in order to increase her turnover and income, Aminatou Olayitan is requesting a loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the EGBE IRERE group.

loans.use: to buy grains (maize, millet) and plates.

loans.name: Sangay

texts.en: Sangay is 31 years old and lives in Kakata Town with her two children, who are between 7 and 8 years old and are in school.  She is an 8th grade student. She says she has been attending night school for a year.  Sangay has been selling rice by the cup in the market.  A problem she facing is the high price of rice by the bag (wholesale price).   Sangay is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.  She says she enjoys her business because people trust her and sometime her supplier gives her rice as credit.  Her plan is to expands her business.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Pedro Jr

texts.en:
Pedro is a 30-year-old fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He started a fishing business 2 years ago. He earns 4,500 PHP per month with this business. Pedro works hard to become a successful fisherman. He also plans to save for his future family.

Pedro is requesting a loan to purchase fishing hooks and nets. Pedro hopes to have a stable business. He plans to use his profit to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: purchase fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Esperanza De Dios 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Soneta is the coordinator of her group Esperanza de Dios (God's Wish) 1 & 2.  This is a Haitian group composed of 10 micro-entrepreuner women located in La Romana, an area where the economy is dominated by sugar cane. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Soneta is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her foodstand by purchasing rice, sugar, canned food, cooking oil, snack products (juices, soda, cookies and others). She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and save for her future plans. Soneta thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: buy food to sell in her foodstand

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu lives in Kakata Town.  She is 45 years old and has three children between the ages of 4 and 25, two are in school and live at home while the oldest one lives on his own and attends college.  Bendu did not go to school herself.  For the past twenty years, she has been selling dried and fresh fish in the market. She says nothing makes her smile and laugh compared to her business  because of the interaction of her customers and friends  who sell the same goods (dried and fresh fish).  She says sometimes they are friendly and sometimes they are not. She is asking a loan to buy more dried and fresh fish for her business.  Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah live in Kakata Town.  She is 50 years old and has four children between the ages of 21 and 35 years old. They all live on their own.  For the past 30 years, Siah has been running a business where she sells oil, salt, vita (juice), pepper, and other items.  She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her friends.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, salt, vita, rice, pepper and other items for her business.  Her plans is to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil ,salt ,vita, rice, pepper and others  items for her business

loans.name: Mujeres De Suenos Y Metas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Amanda is a member of the Mujeres De Sueños y Metas (Women of Dreams and Goals ) 1 & 2 group. This group is comprised of ten women with small businesses who sell different products. Amanda is a single mother with three children. They live in the city of Santo Domingo. She has always worked hard to give her children what she was not able to have in her childhood. 

Amanda’s business is a butcher shop. She sells different types of meat like chicken, pork, and beef. She has been working in this business for about five years. This is her 8th loan with Esperanza Internancional. She is very grateful because she has been able to advance and invest in her business with the loans. She will use this new loan to buy more beef, chicken and some pigs.

This group is located in an area with scant resources in the city of Santo Domingo. It is to the north of the city.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken and some pigs

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en: Maxima runs a tailoring shop in Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has children. She provides general alterations to clothing and now also accepts repairs for shoes and umbrellas. Maxima earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business. She requested a loan to purchase needles, threads and cloths. She hopes for her business to grow and for her family to have a better living condition.

loans.use: purchase needles, threads and cloths

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu is 40 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has six children between 11 to 21 years old, two are attending school and live at home, while the other four are living on their own.  Bendu did not go to school herself.  Her husband is a  businessman.  For the past seven years, Bendu has been selling cassavas, potatoes, eddoes (taros) and yams.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cassavas, potatoes, eddoes and yams for her business.  She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit and has customers.  She hopes to build a house and shop for her business.

loans.use: by cassavas, potatoes, eddoes and yams

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en: Zoe is 40 years old and lives in Bardnesville. She is married and has 3 children who are in school and live at home.  She stopped her education in 10th grade.  Since 2010 she has been selling groundnut and palm oil.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, charcoal and palm oil for her business. She started this business with the little amount received from her husband.  Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: buy rice, charcoal and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is the lady pounding fufu.  She operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold).  This she has done for 2 years. The food she  serves are fufu, banku and rice balls.   Esi is married and has 2 children.   She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase foodstuff and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profit, Esi  plan to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Abdulatif

texts.ru: Более 15 лет Абдулатиф занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур, а также купле- продажей скота. Он трудолюбивый и честный человек, женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Абдулатиф хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль. Он намерен отремонтировать свой дом и улучшить свое благосостояние семьи. Абдулатиф запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Abdulatif has been involved in agriculture, as well as in buying and selling livestock, for more than 15 years.  He is a hardworking and honest man, married and raising three children. Abdulatif wants to expand his business to increase his profits.  He intends to renovate his house and improve the well-being of his family.  Abdulatif is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle in order to expand his business. He looks forward to your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a fish vendor.  She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them for sale.  She has been doing this  for 7 years now. Esther is married and has 4 children.  She uses her income to support her husband  to feed and clothe their children.  Esther will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale.  Esther will expand her business with the new profit

loans.use: buy fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a baker.  She bakes bread for sale, which she has done for 10 years now. She is married with 2 children. Margaret uses her income to help  her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Margaret will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery. With the new profit she will buy an oven to make her work easy.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a small-scale trader. She sells food items and groceries, which she has done for 3 years. She is married to a farmer and has 2 children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills. Hannah will uses her loan to purchase food items and groceries to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase food items and groceries to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Angela Leonor

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 3 De Mayo  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 55 años de edad, está separada, pero de esa relación tuvo tres 8 hijos, dos de ellos fallecieron lo cual para ella fue un golpe muy duro, sus otros hijos ya son mayores de edad. 

Ella para salir adelante y poder ganar algo para su sustento y el de su familia, tiene una  tienda de comestibles en su casa, nos cuenta que empezó con poco y que desde allí con la ayuda de los créditos que fue recibiendo la fue surtiendo mas y mas, en la actualidad vende de todo con la finalidad de ir ganado más clientes con el paso de los días,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados. Tiene 9 años con su negocio y gracias a esto sale adelante sola.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 9 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos se gana la vida en su negocio. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The village bank "May 3rd" meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, an area called the sultan of coffee for the extensive coffee crop with an incomparable taste. It is also known for the cuisine and the warmth of the people. 

Here we meet Angela, 55, who is separated from her husband, with whom she had 8 children. Two of them died which was very hard on her; the others are grown now.

In order to get ahead and make something to sustain her family, she has a grocery store in her home. She tells us that she started with very little and with the help of loans she increased her stock more and more. Currently she sells a wide variety of products, with the goal of bringing in more customers over time. She works every day from 6am til 8pm, sometimes later. Her kids help out when they are able and free. She has been in this business for 9 years and thanks to this it she is able to support herself.

This loan will be used to stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages and other basic goods. She has been in the village bank for 9 years and likes it because thanks to the loans she is able to make a living from her business. 

Her goals are to continue moving forward with her business and for her store to keep growing every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages and other basic goods.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким проживает в районе  Яван. Ему  31 год. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он живет вместе с родителями. Его отец работает в дехканском хозяйстве, а жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается  животноводством. Разводит мелко – рогатый и крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа телят и корма.
texts.en: Hakim lives in the district of Yavan. He is 31 years old, married, and has five children. He lives with his parents. His father works on a dehkan farm and his wife is a homemaker. Hakim himself is involved in animal husbandry. He raises small livestock and cattle at home.  He is taking a loan to buy calves and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy calves and animal feed.

loans.name: Junneh

texts.en:
Junneh is 40 years old and lives in Bardnesville. She is married and has 7 children with ages between 10 to 24.  She stopped her education in 9th grade.  Her husband is a contractor.  

Since 2009 Junneh has been selling sugar, rice, butter, and palm oil in the local market.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, butter, sugar and palm oil for her business.  She started this business with money that she received from her husband. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: buy rice, butter, sugar and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Sofo

texts.en: Sofo operates a breakfast stall at Adum Banso.  She serves Milo, coffee, bread and fried eggs, which she has done for 2 years now.  Sofo is married and has 2 children.  She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home.  Sofo  will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, Milo, coffee and eggs to serve her customers.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, Milo, coffee and eggs

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort operates a grocery shop at Benso near Takoradi.  This she has done for 2 years.  The items in her grocery shop are tin fish, tin tomatoes, Milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, etc.   Comfort is married to a teacher and has 3 children.   She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees.   She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Comfort  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a fish vendor.  She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them for sale.  Efua has been selling smoked fish for 2 years now. She is married and has one child.  She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  Efua will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale.  She will expand her business with the new profit

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Lamzira

texts.en:
Lamzira is a 47-year-old farmer from Martvili District. She lives with her mother (a pensioner).  Lamzira earns a living through an agricultural business. She has 2 milk cows. Lamzira milks the cows 2 times a day and collects the milk for cheese production. With the collected milk, Lamzira produces on average 40 kg of cheese per month and sells it on local open market.  

Along with the dairy farm, Lamzira is busy with beekeeping. She has 30 beehives with bee colonies.  Lamzira harvests honey twice a year and sells it on local market as well. The total average monthly income for the family is 450 Laris, including the monthly pension from Lamzira’s mother.

Lamzira requested credit for the expansion of her beekeeping business. She will purchase 5 more beehives and bee colonies which will increase the amount of gathered honey by approximately 20%.  This will have a positive influence on her income and the living conditions of her family. Lamzira plans to make some savings and renovate her house, which is already old and needs some repair to become comfortable for living.

loans.use: expand her beekeeping business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells tubers of yam at Adum Banso near Takoradi.  She has been in this business for 3 years now.  Mary is divorced and has 4 children.  As a single parent, she uses her income for the general upkeep of her children.  Mary will use her loan to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy yams to sell

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is from a small village of Martvili District, West Georgia. She is 55 years old, married, and lives with her husband Avtandil and her 86-year-old mother-in-law. Liana and Avtandil run an agricultural business, which is the only source of income for the family. In particular, they have a plot of land, where 200 nut trees are grown. Avtandil sells nuts in the fall at the local open market. 

Along with the abovementioned, they run a small dairy farm with 3 milk cows. Liana produces on average 60 kg of traditional West-Georgian cheese and Avtandil sells it at the local open market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 lari.

Liana requested credit for expansion of the cattle-shed. She plans to expand the dairy farm through adding additional cows, but the existing cattle-shed doesn’t allow her to implement this plan. After the building is expanded, Liana will purchase calves and raise them. After a year she will be able to double production and sales of cheese and the income of the family will significantly increase. All members of the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for expansion of the cattle-shed

loans.name: Lola Carminia

texts.es: La Sra. Lola tiene 50 años no está casada pero convive con su pareja, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su puesto de venta  que se encuentran en uno de los mercados de la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lola va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería en abarrotes como fideo, azúcar y arroz por mayor para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Lola enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar constantemente su trato con su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en: Lola, 50, is not married but lives with her partner. She sells groceries in a stall in one of the markets in the town of El Torno. This loan is her first with the institution. Lola will use this loan to buy merchandise like noodles, sugar and rice in bulk to stock her store. Her reason for asking for the loan is a lack of business capital. The challenge that Lola faces in her business is to constantly improve her attention to customers, and she will use the benefits of the loan to keep improving her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries like noodles, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mwinga

texts.en:
Mwinga, a resident of Mariakani, Kenya, has been running a transport business for three years. The town is situated along the highway linking the Coastal town and the upcountry parts of the Country. It, therefore, receives a high number of goods and peoples in transit to other towns.

Mwinga is married and has three children. Mwinga was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 to make repairs on his vehicle. His ambition for the future is to purchase another motorcycle and to purchase a piece of land upon which to build rental houses.

The main challenge facing Mwinga’s business is high fuel costs. The additional income from this loan will help him finance his children’s education.

loans.use: to make vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. The town is located along the Mombasa – Nairobi highway; a highway linking the two most important cities in the country. Monica runs a grocery/fruits and vegetables stall. The business has been in operation for seven years. She is single and has five children. She obtained the capital to start the business from the sale of eggs; a business she owned prior to this.

Monica is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase stock of fruits and vegetables to open up another stall. Her future goals include purchasing a piece of land and building a house. The additional income will, therefore, go towards increasing her source of income in order to achieve her goals, despite the challenge of seasonal business due to climate and price fluctuations.

loans.use: to purchase stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mwakamsha

texts.en:
Mwakamsha is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He owns a retail shop which he started from his savings. The business has been in operation for three years. Mwakamsha is a married father of seven children. He learnt of Milango through friends and promotions.

Mwakamsha is applying for a loan of KES 73,050 to install a security door/grill and to add retail stock, e.g. soap, sugar, flour etc. His ambition is to open other retail outlets in the future and he believes the additional income from this venture will help him to pay for his children’s school fees. The challenge Mwakamsha needs to overcome is the high transportation costs and ensuring his customers pay on time.

loans.use: to install a security door/grill and to add retail stock, e.g. soap, sugar, flour etc.

loans.name: Enhzaya

texts.en: Enhzaya, 42, lives with her husband and two children in Selenge province in Northern Mongolia. Her children go to the college and kindergarten. She started a garment retail business in 2002. Now the business activities are stable. Besides selling garments, she is planning to sell beauty supplies. She has established a number of regular customers. Enhzaya is a responsible and diligent woman who says, "I would like to increase the volume of my business. I need some support to increase the type of products." She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy beauty supplies.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Silbio Antonio

texts.es: El señor Silbio, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante de frutas y verduras , para apoyarlos con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos todavía tienen hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia un futuro es poder brindar estudios a sus hijos para que logren ejercer una carrera universitaria , don Silbio desde hace varios años se dedica al trabajo de agricultura especialmente al cultivo piña , la mayor afectación que se le presentan son las plagas que invaden al mismo , ya que el no cuenta con los recursos económicos para poder combatir de un sola vez toda la plaga , tanto de roedores como la mosca blanca que son totalmente dañina para la plantación . El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos.
texts.en: Silbio lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife, who sells fruits and vegetables to help with the household expenses since they have children to care for. Their plan for the future is to be able to put their kids through school so that they can go to university. Silbio has worked for some years as a farmer, specifically cultivating pineapple. The biggest challenge is the insects that invade the crop, because he doesn't have the financial resources to be able combat them once and for all. The white flies are totally damaging to the plantation. He wants this loan to buy fertilizer and inputs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and inputs.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru:
Розе 59 лет, вдова, имеет 2 детей. Роза на протяжении 20 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Розы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы и 7 овец, продажа молока и молочных продуктов составляет 3,500 сом в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Roza is 59 years old.  She is a widow and has two children. For the past twenty years, she has been involved in farming and animal husbandry, a business she got into with an initial amount of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, her business now comprises two dairy cows and seven sheep, and she makes 3,500 som per month selling milk and dairy products.

In order to further develop her business, Roza has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 135,000 (KGS) which will be used to purchase young bulls to be fattened up and resold.  Roza plans to invest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her livestock business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica lives together with her husband and 4 children in Adum Banso near Takoradi. Monica is a fish vendor.  She smokes fish for sale, which she has done for 5 years. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Monica will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Las Perlas 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the coordinator of the Las Perlas (The Pearl) 1, 2 & 3 group. This group is composed of 15 micro-entrepreuners located in the city of La Santo Domingo. Her family is made up of three children and her husband. Her children are attending school, while she is working at home making curtains and decaration sets for bathrooms and bedrooms. She is running a decoration business.

Dominga is very excited to receive her 4th loan through Esperanza International. She took her first loan around 2 year ago. Receiving these loans has made it possible to invest in her small business and give her a step forward to increase her inventory and sales. She will invest by purchasing fabric, thread, accessories, and other materials to decorate. One of Dominga's dreams is to become a famous decorator and expand her business to other levels and areas. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy decoration items (curtain set, bedding, accessories)

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en: Hawah is a fish vendor.  She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them for sale.  She has been selling smoked fish for 4 years now. Hawah is married and has 3 childern.  She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  Hawah will use her loan to purchase fresh  fish to smoke for sale.  Hawah will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret  lives together with her husband and 2 children in Adum Banso near Takoradi.  Margaret is a fish vendor.  She smokes fish for sale, which she has done for 5 years.   She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Margaret will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia operates a  grocery shop in Benso near Takoradi.  This she has done for 2 years.  The items in her grocery shop are tin fish, tin tomatoes, Milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees,  milk, soap, etc.  Lydia is married to a teacher and has 3 children.   She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees.   Lydia will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Lydia  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Las Mariposas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Alejandra is one of the members of Las Mariposas (Butterflies) 1 & 2. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. These ten women are dedicated to working hard and developing their business to bring changes to their families and their community.

Alejandra makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children.  She is a single mother and her children are attending school. Alejandra is excited to be taking out her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business.  She runs a beauty salon and this loan is to invest in purchasing hair and beauty products. She will use the profits to cover her home expenses.  Also, she is planning to reinvest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He is a fruits and vegetables vendor, a business he has run for four years in this coastal town. Mohamed was introduced to Milango through his friends. This area boasts of a large population of people owing to the low income of most residents.

Mohamed is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to add stocks of fruits and vegetables to his business. His ambition is to grow the business and start other income generating activities. Mohamed therefore intends to save the extra income obtained from this loan for his future projects.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He has been running a retail business for one year. He is a married man and has two children. In this venture, Benjamin retails common household goods. He started the business from a capital of about $300. At this time, Benjamin does not have regular customers. He now goes about delivering the goods to his customers.

Benjamin is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase more retail stock, e.g. bread, milk, etc. He aspires to grow the business and have more shops. He believes the additional income from this business will help him pay school fees, medical bills and have some capital for his business expansion. The challenge facing his business is the high cost of products.

loans.use: buy products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is a 37 year old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in Umnugovi province, Mongolia. His wife is employed. The children study at the secondary school. 

Ganzorig started an animal hides retails business in 2000. He purchases the animal raw materials, such as skin, and trades them at the border cities. Ganzorig is a bright man who says "I would like to develop the business activities by purchasing the raw materials by wholesale. I have a detailed plan of my business future". The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to buy more animal hides for the business.

loans.use: to buy more animal hides for the business.

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en: Gombo, 73, lives with his wife in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife helps in her husband's business. He has had 16 years of experience growing vegetables and trading them. Gombo graduated from an agricultural university as an agronomist in 1961. He keeps the vegetables in underground storage, which has 30 tons of capacity. His wife sells the vegetables at the shop counter. In the winter time, he plants vegetables in the greenhouse. He has been running the business activities successfully, improving his livelihood level significantly. Gombo is a hardworking and very active man who says that "I would like to develop the business activities by purchasing some extra seed so that I could increase the volume." He is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to buy organic fertilizer and potato seed.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and potato seed.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has been selling women’s lingerie in a local market for six years. She is 40 years old and lives with her partner and two children. A loan will help her purchase more merchandise such as socks, underwear, and bras from wholesalers in Lima and Juliaca, a town near the border with Bolivia. Maria dreams of becoming a great businesswoman. She and her daughter have been talking about opening a store to rent and sell dresses for special occasions such as weddings and quinceañeras (a 15th birthday celebration which is similar to a “Sweet Sixteen” for girls).

Maria is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Amistad Cusqueña" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy women's lingerie such as socks, underwear, and bras

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages.

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en: Batmunh, 47, lives with his wife and three children in Selenge province in Northern Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. The children go to the secondary school and kindergarten. He started an auto service business in 2003. He has experience in the field so he has many regular customers and the business activities are stable. Batmunh is responsible for what he is doing and he says, "I would like to expand the business activities by purchasing the necessary spare parts for the auto service business." He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio, 52, has worked as a taxi driver in Cusco for 20 years. He also has a second business as a wholesale distributor of books. He is married with four children, two of whom are living independently. A loan will help Leoncio buy Bibles from Lima to distribute at wholesale. His goal is to open two more branches of his book distribution business.

Leoncio is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Amistad Cusqueña" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy Bibles for wholesale distribution.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old and has two children. She has been operating a call center for about two years. Locals can come to her store in order to make phone calls using Claro and Movistar networks. Every year, Elizabeth has to pay about 1,000 soles (PEN) to each network provider in order to guarantee continued use of her phone lines. A loan will help her pay these fees. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to save enough money to buy a car.

Elizabeth is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Amistad Cusqueña" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay for telephone services

loans.name: Henry Santiago

texts.en:
Henry Santiago is 24 years old and drives a taxi. He has had this job for about one year, and is requesting a loan so that he can renew his taxi license. He previously studied to be a chef, and in the future he would like to open a restaurant.

Henry Santiago is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Amistad Cusqueña" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to renew his taxi license

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Rosario has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, shampoo, bath soap and beverages.

Rosario has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rosario hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizers, insecticides and maintain her flower farm

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue is requesting a new loan to purchase equipment and materials for his motorcycle washing business. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase motorcycle washing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy animal feed and chicks starter

loans.name: Lizbeth Mirian

texts.en:
Lizbeth Mirian is a seamstress who sews clothes as well as alpaca products such as hats, sweaters, scarves, gloves, and vests. She is 25 years old, married and has one child. She sells her goods at wholesale.  The business Lizbeth Mirian works for currently has two industrial sewing machines and Lizbeth Mirian is requesting a loan in order to invest in one more. In the future, she would like to open an independent business.

Lizbeth Mirian is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Amistad Cusqueña" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 50-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a driver for hire. For five years, she has run a food stall to sell meals for people in her community.

Diep would like a loan to purchase better quality food and ingredients to make better meals for selling. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.  She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen is 38 years old and is married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Huyen and her husband have run a general store at their house for ten years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectionery, etc. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

Huyen hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio is 38 years old, married, and has two children. For the last three years, he has been the owner of a business providing taxi transportation services. He now has two cars and employs drivers, whereas previously he used to drive his own car. In addition, Lucio has a restaurant business. A loan will help Lucio fix one of his cars. Specifically, he needs to replace the battery and repaint the exterior. He looks forward to acquiring more cars and expanding his business in the future.

Lucio is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Amistad Cusqueña" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to replace his car battery and repaint the exterior

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is requesting a new loan to buy more and better quality food for selling. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell from her stall

loans.name: No

texts.en:
No, 56, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn an income selling chemical fertilizers in their store. 

No started this business five years ago. This helps him to cover family expenses and his children's school fees. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying different kinds of fertilizers to meet the demands of his customers.

No hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to resell

loans.name: Rang

texts.en:
Rang, 48, is married and has three children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife have been running a cafe in front of their house to sell soft drinks, coffee and food for twenty years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater quantity and variety of beverages to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 29 years old and is a mechanic for motors. He can repair motors from all sorts of vehicles and machinery in his workshop. For example, clients may bring him cars, motorcycles, chainsaws, or water pumps in need of repair. A loan will help Juan Carlos purchase a kit of replacement parts for motors. His dream is to expand his shop to an even larger studio in the future.

Juan Carlos is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Amistad Cusqueña" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase a kit of replacement parts for motors

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor has been a taxi driver in Cusco for 25 years. He runs the family business, which now has three cars in total. He is requesting a loan in order to pay for maintenance such as oil change and new tires. Victor is 48 years old and has five children, three of whom are working. He has a plot of land on which he hopes to build a second home in the future. There, he would like to start a business raising livestock and rabbits.

Victor is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Amistad Cusqueña" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 50 years old and is married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband helps her to run a food stall for earning a living. 

Lien started her business ten years ago and makes many kinds of dishes to sell to people in her local community. She would like to take a loan to buy a greater amount of ingredients and food. This will enable her to expand her business by making a greater quanity and range of meals to sell from her stall.  

Lien hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 39 years old, is married and has a son. She lives with her son and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports the family through the income he earns from driving.  Phuong started her business of selling food over nine years ago. She sells soups and noodles to people in her community. 

Phuong intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy better quality ingredients to make better food so that she can attract more new customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 58 years old and is a single mother of five children living in Prey Chor district. She raises her children with all of her effort working in the rice field from day to day. Thanks to her business, she is able to provide daily sustenance for her children. She has been in this business for 33 years. To assist Hang and the family, four of her children decided to work separately to generate income so they can pursue a comfortable living and get out of poverty.

In this coming raining season, Hang is preparing her soil to start growing her rice, but due to the lack of sufficient funds, she is now asking for a loan from HKL to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers to sow on her land. With the help from the loan, Hang hopes to make a fruitful harvest from her investment. She is very happy and appreciative to our lenders from the distance.

loans.use: buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jimmy Bernardo

texts.en:
Jimmy Bernardo has been working as a taxi driver for five years. He has his own car and would like a loan in order to pay for maintenance such as new tires and a tune-up. He is 33 years old and lives with his partner and daughter. In the future, Jimmy Bernardo would like to have a bus so that he can offer transportation services to large groups. 

Jimmy Bernardo is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Amistad Cusqueña" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions

loans.use: buy beverages to sell

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le is requesting a new loan to buy good quality food to sell to her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her income. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu is requesting a new loan to buy good ingredients to make better food for selling. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for pigs like hog starter and hog finisher

loans.name: La Fuente Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento  La Fuente está compuesto por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco es La Sra. Martha tiene 43 años y es casada con un hijo que tiene la edad de  cinco años, ella se dedica a la venta de empanada y refresco, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicada en la zona La Fuente de la localidad La Guardia,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Martha va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus empanadas y refrescos como harina y azúcar,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo para la compra de  insumos, la Sra. Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que es el de ir teniendo más clientela de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo y  va a utilizar los beneficios en dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, la Sra. Martha se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The entrepreneurship bank La Fuente is made of up nine members: eight women and one man. The president of the bank is Martha. She is 43 years old and married with one child who is five years old. She makes a living selling pasties and soft drinks from her food stall which is located in the area La Fuente, part of the locality of La Guardia. This loan is her first loan cycle with the institution and Martha is going to use it to buy supplies for making pasties and soft drinks like flour and sugar. The reason she has requested this loan is due to her lack of working capital for the purchase of these supplies. Martha faces challenges in her business like having more customers. In this way she will increase her working capital and use the benefits to give her family a better life. Martha feels happy with and thankful for the institution for the support they've given.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar to make pasties and soft drinks.

loans.name: Doeurn

texts.en:
Doern, 28,  is a local farmer from Kompong Cham province,  She is taking out a loan from HKL, one of Kiva partner, to improve her farming business. She will use the loan amounts of KHR 3,000,000 to rend a tractor to till her land and buy bean seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. Those farming supplies will help her farming process and generate more income to better her living status. 

Doeurn is responsible for three lovely three kids, some of whom are attending school. For her future plan, she wants to save a part of her generated income to expand her land size in order to increase her output within the year. And she wishes to provide her children with further education as her legacy.

loans.use: till her land and buy seeds, fertilizers & pesticides

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Jurenda

texts.en:
Jurenda is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 7 children. 

Jurenda has a retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 18,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, detergents & beverages.

Jurenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jurenda hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en: Muoi is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quanity of ingredients and food for her stall. Muoi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Diem

texts.en: Diem is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mean, 47, is a widowed mother who is responsible for three children.  They are living together in Kompong Cham province.  Mean has been managing a farming business for almost 22 years to generate a living and raise her family. However, the income she earns can just meet the needs of their daily food. To better her situation, Mean would like to expand her land size to increase her output as well as her household income. Due to the lack of sufficient funds, she is now asking for a loan from HKL to supplement her savings to buy a piece of farmland. With the leftover amount, she would like to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and herbicides to sow on her land. She believes that she will be able to reach her goal successfully as she strives to work out her plan with the great and constant help from our lenders. She thanks all of you in advance from the distance.

loans.use: buy farmland and farm inputs

loans.name: Libio Marín

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a don Libio, tiene 42 años de edad, está separado, pero de esa relación tuvo 4  hijos, una de ellos tiene 12 años, estudia en colegio y es la que vive con él en casa de sus padres. 

Él se dedica al comercio, vende  gafas, gorras y otros artículos, nos cuenta que para realizar sus ventas él se desplaza los fines de semana hasta otras localidades como: Salinas, Atacames y otras playas para vender sus productos, él también elabora llaveros en varias  formas y tamaños y vende en sus viajes. Lleva más de 15 años realizando esta labor y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar más gafas, gorras y materiales para elaborar sus llaveros, lleva 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. 

Su sueño es comprar un carro para ir a vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “3 de Mayo” [May 3rd] meets every fifteen days in the canton of Jipijapa, a canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine, and for the warmth of its people.

This is where we meet Libio who is 42 years old, separated, and has four children. One of his children is 12, studies in school, and is the one that lives with him in his parent’s house.  

He makes his living as a merchant, selling glasses, hats, and other items.  He tells us that to make sales he travels on weekends to other towns like Salinas, Atacames, and other beaches to sell his products.  He also makes key chains in different shapes and sizes and sells them on his trips. He has been doing this work for more than 15 years and he does very well. 

This loan is to buy more glasses, hats, and materials to make key chains.  He has been a member of the communal bank for two years and he likes it because of the help it has given him. 

His dream is to buy a car to use to sell his products.

loans.use: to buy glasses, hats, and materials to make key chains.

loans.name: Mayra Mariela

texts.es: Mayra tiene 28 años, soltera y de profesión Administración de empresa. Vive en Playas en la casa de sus padres. Hace un año y un mes empezó su comercio en la zona donde vive ya que no había despensas a su alrededor. Con el conocimiento adquirido en sus estudios se dio cuenta que tenía una gran oportunidad por la poca competencia. Sus actividades inician de lunes a sábado desde las 8 am hasta las 6 de la tarde. Por el momento no ha tenido mayores inconvenientes en su sector. No tiene hijos pero no descarta la posibilidad en un futuro de casarse y tenerlos. El crédito lo empleara en la compra de productos de bazar, víveres, arroz, azúcar, snacks, etc. Su meta en unos años es aumentar su capital para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayra is 28 years old, single, and has a degree in Business Administration. She lives in Playas at the home of her parents. A year and a half ago, she established a business in her area because there were no other stores around. With the knowledge she acquired from her studies, she took advantage of this great opportunity resulting from the lack of competition. Her activities are conducted Monday through Saturday beginning at 8am and lasting until 6pm. At the moment, she faces no major challenges in the area. Mayra has no children, but she does not rule out the possibility of getting married in the future and having them.

This loan will be used to buy bazaar products, provisions, rice, sugar, snacks, and other items. One of her goals in a few years is to increase her capital so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: provisions, rice, sugar, snacks, and other items.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo tiene 53 años, hace 12 años vive con Felicia, la madre de su única hija, Joselin. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el barrio Bellavista en Tarma.

Él es un hombre de muchas actividades, hace 30 años que se dedica al servicio de trasporte de pasajeros con su propia movilidad. Con las ganancias obtenidas empezó a criar animales como cuyes y chanchos, los cuales engorda y luego los vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. “Por cada chancho estoy ganado de 300 a 400 soles, si me conviene”, menciona.
Ahora también tiene un negocio de cereales y granos molidos. Para ello adquirió un molino que le facilita el trabajo. De esa manera elabora harinas de quinua, maca, soya, maíz y otros. Cuenta que la va muy bien, pues compra sus insumos en Lima, para después moler las harinas, cuyo peso se duplica y vende por kilo.
Y como es un hombre emprendedor y visionario, ahora piensa dedicarse a la crianza de animales mayores como vacas y toros, los que criará y venderá en la ciudad.

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y se siente a gusto de formar parte de un grupo tan solidario. Éste sería su crédito número 5 de MFP, y confía que logrará sus metas gracias al apoyo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Arturo, con el dinero solicitado, comprará 5 terneras que criará para su posterior venta. Además comprará insumos; como granos y cereales para continuar con su negocio de harinas.
texts.en:
Arturo is 53 years old and has lived 12 years with Felicia, the mother of his only daughter Joselin. They live in their own home in the neighborhood of Bellavista in Tarma.

Arturo engages in many activities. For the past 30 years, he has been providing transportation services to passengers with his own vehicle. With the earnings he obtained, he began raising animals, such as guinea pigs and pigs, and fattening them for eventual resale at the wholesale market in the city. "For each pig, I earn between 300 to 400 PEN, which suits me fine," mentions Arturo. Now he also sells grains and ground kernels. In order to start this business, he had to acquire a grain mill to facilitate his work. He is able to produce flour made from quinoa, maca root, soybeans, corn, and other grains. Arturo says he has done very well. He buys his supplies in Lima and then grinds the grains to produce flour. His output is double the original weight and sold by the kilo. As an enterprising and visionary man, Arturo now plans to spend time raising larger animals, such as cows and bulls. He will raise them and then sell them in the city.

He is a member of the Communal Bank "Señor de Muruhuay" and is comfortable working as part of a solidarity group. This will be his fifth loan with MFP and he is confident that he can accomplish his goals as a result of this support. In addition, he promises to be punctual with his loan payments. Arturo, with the money he requested, will buy five calves to raise for eventual resale. In addition, he will buy supplies, such as kernels and grains, so that he can continue his flour business.

loans.use: to purchase five calves and grains to process into flour.

loans.name: Marìa Haydee

texts.es:
María es una mujer  de 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con 2 hijos a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en la parte rural del Distrito de Tambogrande, del departamento de Piura;  solo cuentan con servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de una pileta comunal; bajo estas condiciones viven todas las familias de esta zona.

La actividad principal  que desarrolla María es la crianza/venta de ovinos y aves de corral, estos los cría en corrales que están en la parte posterior de su casa, donde les alimenta a base de concentrado, y cuando tienen el tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; María tiene experiencia en este tipo de negocio y su cónyuge también le apoya con estas actividades.

El monto del crédito otorgado es de S/. 1,500 nuevos soles y será para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales, y así venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado local, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a 27-year-old woman with a live-in partner and two children. She lives with her partner and her children in the rural part of the Tambogrande district, in the Piura province. They only have basic electrical service and they receive their water from a communal fountain. All of the families in this area live under these conditions.

Maria's main activity is raising and selling sheep and poultry, which she keeps on a farm behind her house. She feeds them from concentrate and when they are the exact size and weight, she sells them to wholesalers in the area. She has experience in this kind of business and her partner also supports her with these activities.

The the amount of the loan provided is 1,500 Peruvian nuevos soles and will be used to buy balanced feed to fatten up her animals so that she can sell them at a better price at the local market. This investment will allow her to continue growing in her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten up animals

loans.name: Juana Gloria

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Juana, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen nueve hijos, siete mayores de edad y dos de 15 y 9 años los mismos estudian en colegio y escuela, cuatro de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.
 
Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y en épocas de entrada a clases también vende útiles escolares,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su  esposo le ayuda en su negocio  cuando está  desocupado. Nos cuenta que a `pesar de que su negocio recién tiene 4 años cuenta con muy buena clientela que todos los días hacen sus compras en su local y esto es por la buena atención que ellos ofrecen. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar útiles escolares y aprovechar que es lo que más se vende en estos momentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le  gusta por ala ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos para aumentar su tienda.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante y aumentado su tienda aun mas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “3 de Mayo” [May 3rd] meets every fifteen days in the canton of Jipijapa, a canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine, and for the warmth of its people.

This is where we meet Juana who is 49 years old and married.  She has nine children of which seven are grown.  Her two younger children are 15 and 9 and are studying in secondary and primary school, respectively.  Four of her children still live with her. Her husband works occasionally. 

She has a general store in her house where she sells all types of basic staple products.  And at the start of the school term she also sells schools supplies. She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her husband helps her with the business when he isn’t busy.  She tells us that although her business is only 4 years old, she has very good customers that buy from her on a daily basis which is due to the good service that they offer. 

She will use this loan to buy school supplies and make the most of this time when school supplies are what sells best.  She has been with this communal bank since its inception and she likes it because of the loans it gives her to help her expand her store. 

Her dream is to get ahead and expand her store even more.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Dowoé

texts.fr:
Dowoè est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée à un agent commercial. Elle a 2 enfants, tous  à l’école. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 1 ans.
Dowoè travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1992. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Dowoè a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Dowoè voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité en ouvrant un dépôt de débit de boissons. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dowoè is a 40 year old woman. She is married to a salesman. She has 2 children, both go to school. The first is 5 and the second is 1 year old.
Dowoè has worked as a saleswoman since 1992. She sells groceries to all the customers in her shop. She buys her stock in Lomé. She works alone. At present, her main difficulty is inventory shortage.
Dowoè requests her third loan from WAGES in order to buy groceries. She would like to reinvest in the business.
Over the coming years, Dowoè would like to increase the size of her business by opening a beverage bar. She says that with the profits, she plans to provide a radiant future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Yader Enrique

texts.es: El señor Yader , es habitante del municipio de Nindiri , comunidad piedra menuda , junto a su esposa la cual labora para una empresa privada y así apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia un  futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Yader desde hace varios años labora en una empresa privada , pero su sueldo no le ajusta para poder comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción para poder terminar de construir un cuarto ya que su hijo va creciendo y necesita de privacidad ya que todos duermen en un mismo cuarto , con el préstamo anterior logro poner la cerámica en la sala de la vivienda . El préstamo lo necesita para comprar bloques , cemento , arena, piedrín , etc.
texts.en: Yader is a resident of the town of Nindiri , a Piedra Menuda community. He lives with his wife who works for a private business and helps with the household expenses. His plans for the future are to improve his quality of life. For several years, Yader has worked at a private business, but the salary isn't enough to buy construction materias all at once to finish building a room, since his son is growing and needs privacy, as all of them sleep in the same room. With the previous loan he  was able to put ceramic flooring in the house. He needs the loan to buy blocks, cement, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for pigs, such as hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, such as hog grower, for pigs and medicine for deworming

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en:
Zorigt, 47, is a mechanical engineer. But he is unemployed and he runs a taxi business using his old car. He has been running his business since 2004, after he left his job. Sometimes he employs the service of old Russian cars cheaply, around his neighborhoods and acquaintances. He lives with his wife, children, his oldest brother and his brother's wife in their plot of land in Kherlen, an eastern city of Mongolia. 
They own a small, old house which was built in earlier times. In the last few years, the house has been bad and in need of urgent renovations. In winter time it costs a lot of money to buy the smoky coal and warm his house due to the heating loss through the walls and windows. This is because his house’s wall insulations have all become bad and have been removed. Smoky coal usage has been one of biggest issues in most Mongolian households and cities. 
So Zorigt is planning to make a renovation to his old house in the summer. The loan he is taking will be used to buy the necessary building materials for insulation and other decorations in his house.

loans.use: To buy the necessary building materials for insulation and other decorations in his house.

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Huy is a 44-year-old woman who was born on her family farm and to a low-income family. She has learned traditional methods of farming to generate a livelihood from her parents, and she has been doing this type of business for ages. She is married to a local farmer and has given birth to 10 children. It’s quite a big family that affects their living situation and causes Huy to work tirelessly to raise her children accordingly. Despite her difficulties, Huy aims to provide her children with a good education without thinking of her hard work. She is still happy and enjoys doing her business to achieve her goals.

To make improvements to her business, Huy is now taking out her third loan cycle in the sum of KHR 3,500,000 to purchase small potato plants and grow them for future sale. She believes that this loan will enable her to work out her plans, and hopes that she will have a fruitful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to purchase small potato plants and grow them for future sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire « Chance », est un entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 8 jeunes enfants. Elle est  vendeuse de souliers plastics (bodaboda). Son mari est un officiel de l’administration publique à la marie de la ville Goma. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un marché. Elle commença son business avec son fonds propre, quand,  elle venda sa chainette pour une valeur de 250$. Il y a 6 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  7  cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  24 douzaines de souliers (bodaboda)  à marchander. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et  acheter une seconde maison. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes pour leur émancipation économique et financière.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
The leader of the Chance business group is a dynamic entrepreneur who is 38 years old and the mother of 8 young children. She sells plastic shoes known as “bodaboda”. Her husband is a public administration official at the town hall in Goma. 

She sells her products at a market. She started her business with her own money when she sold an item of jewellery for $250. For six years now she has been running small business activities of this type. 

This is her seventh loan cycle with Hekima. This new loan will be used to purchase 24 dozen pairs of bodaboda to sell. In addition, she would like to buy a second house and see her children grow up in comfort. 

She would like to thank Hekima for the work it does towards the economic and financial emancipation of poor women. 

It should be noted that in the photo certain members are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 24 dozen pairs of footwear (bodaboda)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mahuna 1 Group

texts.fr: MAHUNA 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Cécile (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans. Cécile est mariée à un certain Atchadé. Le couple a sept enfants dont quatre sont à leur charge. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Cécile vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Cécile n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Cécile vend depuis quinze ans, de l’akassa (pâte faite à base de maïs) et de façon secondaire de l’huile de palme à son domicile. Cécile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Cécile sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUNA 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Mahuna 1 is a group of three people who are all friends and live in the same district of Benin. The representative of the group, Cécile (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 40 years old. She is married to a man named Atchadé and the couple have seven children, four of whom are dependents. Some of the children are at school. Cécile lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the various household expenses between them. Cécile did not go to school. In order to be able to cover her various expenses, she has been selling "akassa" (a dough made out of corn) for the past fifteen years; as a secondary activity she sells palm oil from home. Cécile gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and expanding her business, she is requesting a sixth loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the Mahuna 1 group. This loan will allow her to respond better to customer demand and to make more money. The previous loans have all been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy corn and containers of palm oil

loans.name: Gnim

texts.en:
Gnim is a 50-year-old widow who lives with her two grown children in the Prey Chor district. She has devoted herself to a farming business for more than 16 years to earn a living. Typically, she grows rice annually although she would like to do this twice a year. However, her location is far away from the water supplies of her commune. From her earnings, Gnim was able to provide for her children's basic needs and their daily food. 

At the present, Gnim would like to acquire a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle for home use. She is very appreciative for the given funds. She believes that they will help her reduce unnecessary expenses incurred by the family and increase her ability to save for her business plan. In the future, Gnim intends to work on her business and expand her farmland -- thereby increasing her household income.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for home use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and to pay for gasoline for his taxi service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap and beverages for her general store business.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a 55-year-old widowed woman with six children, one of whom is enrolled in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mbodze sells fruits and vegetables, both from her home and door-to-door. She aspires to open a food stall in the future. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She was previously a farmer. Her greatest monthly expense is food and she describes her greatest challenge as the high cost of commodities.
 
With the loan of KES 20,000, Mbodze plans to establish a stall for her operations and also to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to establish a stall for her operations and also to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four children.

Teresita has a barbecue snack food vending business to earn a living. She has been in this type of business for two years. She earns 5,000 PHP each month from these activities.
