She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy more fish stock. Her profits will be used to grow her business. Her dream is to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Souraya

texts.en:
Souraya, 30, is a Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, who are still attending school. She strives to work really hard in order to offer them a better future, with the cooperation of her husband. After many years of experience in the trading field, she decided to start her own home business is 2009, selling all kind of clothes. She works independently and has gained a fair number of shops owners as clients looking to buy her products.

Today, Souraya is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more clothes and other items for her business. She notes that this will help her to develop her work and boost her profits. In the future, she plans to open her own boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Faress

texts.en:
This borrower, who is from Iraq, is 40 years old, married and has four children. Faress has owned an electric generator since 2011, leasing electric lines to people in his surrounding area. Well-known and experienced, he enjoys a good reputation in the area. 

Faress is requesting a loan of  $2400 to repair the generator's engine.  He aims to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his entire family.

loans.use: to repair his generator's engine.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has three children.

Kassem has owned a carpentry workshop since 2006. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for 1,500 USD loan in order to purchase a generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
René, es casado y tiene un hijo pequeño, con el cual vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación pequeña, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto.
René, estudio solo hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas como carpintero realizando puertas y revestimientos en madera ya que no cuenta con otros ingresos para pagar los gastos médicos, alimenticios y de estudios para su hijo, ya que tampoco cuenta con seguro médico.
El trabajo que realiza no es muy peligroso pero si muy sacrificado ya que tiene que cargar con bloques grande de madera para la elaboración de las puertas.
El crédito lo necesita para la compra de maderas, clavos, pegamento, pintura, etc., para la elaboración de otros trabajos para posteriormente ponerlos a la venta. Sus mayores ingresos provienen de trabajos que realiza a pedido.
El sueño de René, es tener su casa propia para dar más comodidad a su familia y también poder tener un taller más grande con esto mejorar su calidad de vida y sus ingresos.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
René is married and has a small son he lives with in his parents’ house occupying just one small bedroom; the house is located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Adela zone.

René only studied up to secondary school and is currently working more than ten hours per day as a carpenter making doors and wood paneling since he has no other source of income to pay for his son’s medical expenses, food and schooling because he does not have health insurance.

The work he does isn’t very dangerous but it is demanding because he has to carry large bundles of lumber to make the doors.

He needs the loan to buy lumber, nails, glue, paint, etc. to make other things to put up for sale later.  His largest payments come from jobs he does to order.

René’s dream is to have his own house to give his family more comfort and to have a larger workshop to improve his quality of life and his income.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy lumber, nails, glue and paint.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio, es casado y tiene dos hijos que estudian en secundaria, viven en  casa propia ocupando solo dos habitaciones con pared de adobe y piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente obtiene ingresos ya que tiene un minibús y se dedica al transporte urbano trabajando por más de diez horas ya que el cubre los gastos de alimentación y estudios de sus hijos. El trabajo que realiza Herminio es bastante peligroso por que trabaja hasta altas horas de la noche. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas de su vehiculo ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Herminio es construir más habitaciones y mejorar las que tiene ya que desea tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Herminio’s married and has two children attending secondary school.  He lives in his own house occupying just two rooms with adobe walls and a dirt floor; the house is located in the city of El Alto.

He earns income at present because he has a minibus and he works providing urban transport for more than ten hours since that’s how he covers his children’s food and education costs.  The work Herminio does is quite dangerous because he works until the wee hours of the night which is why he’s asking for a loan to buy tires for his vehicle because it’s the only source of income he has to support his family.

Herminio’s dream is to build more rooms and improve the ones he has because he’d like to have more comfort and to improve his quality of life.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy tires for his minibus.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en: Zulaika is married with five children. All of her children go to school.  She takes care of additional family members (relatives). She has a business of selling charcoal at the market on retail and has been in this business for 10 years.  She has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO which she wants use to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business she generates additional income through a retail shop. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to go to the village of Luwero to buy bags of charcoal become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. She resides in the home that she owns and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita is married with 3 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lucita owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 9 years and earns PHP 5,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 7,200 to purchase farm chemicals. Lucita has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for 2 years. In the future, Lucita hopes to obtain another plot of farm land in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en: Nulu  is married with 3 children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her mother). She sells charcoal at the market. She sells her products ot retail. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of SHS 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business. She would also like to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 60-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and seven children. Five of them are still studying while the others are working. He’s trying the best he can to enhance his family’s way of life. He has owned a library for seventeen years. He has a good job and is happy about what he has attained so far.  Today, he’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional stationary and books for his library. Definitely, this will develop his business and help him earn more income. In the future, he plans to expand his business and better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stationary and books for his library.

loans.name: Nayfeh

texts.en: Nayfeh is a 36-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and four siblings. Three of them are working. In addition to her father, she cooperates with her siblings to bring added income to the family. She owns an accessories, bags, perfumes, and gifts shop in her town where all the ladies can benefit from her products. Today, she has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy additional items to add to her existing stock such as accessories. She notes that this will return big profits for her. In the future, she plans to add clothes to her shop.

loans.use: to buy additional items to add to her existing stock such as accessories.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdalene is 54 years old, a business lady who is a widowed with two children, ages 22 and 15. She has been running a retail shop as a primary business and rental houses as a secondary business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to cater to her children’s basic needs. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Magdalene will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, and cooking oil.  

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy land for farming which will help her improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares is a 52-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and two children. One of his children works and the other is still a student. Fares supports his family with pleasure and he's ready to show help whenever they need it. For the past 4 years, he has been working on his own, as a van driver. His job consists of transporting his customers from town to town. Fares is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his van and to purchase the required paint for it. This loan will allow him to continue his job properly. In the future, Fares plans to borrow more loans from Kiva and to improve his business.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance and purchase required paint for his van

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with two children, one of whom is enrolled in school. She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water.

For the last two years, Lydia has been operating a retail poultry business, selling her products mostly to hotel owners in the neighborhood. She also owns some rental houses, which supplement her income. High transportation costs are a challenge for Lydia. She hopes to hire employees in the future. Lydia joined Yehu to get funds to expand her business. She plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to buy some chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy some chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
María, es una persona de hogar, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de plátanos y tambien trabaja realizando oficios de ama de casa, la venta de plátanos la inicio hace dos años, lo aprendió de su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de un flete de plátanos verdes, para la venta, este préstamo le ayudara a María para proporcionarles los recursos económicos y realizar la compra, para mantener siempre surtido su negocio.
Ella quiere mejorar el negocio, con otros productos que a futuro ira incluyendo, tambien quiere obtener un local propio donde pueda estar más accesible para los clientes.
texts.en:
María is a homemaker who lives with her husband and her three sons.  She works selling plantains and also works doing household jobs.  The selling of plantains she began two years ago and she learned it from her family.  

She is asking for a loan for the purchase of a freight of green plantains to sell.  This loan will help her by giving her the economic means to realize her sales and to maintain her business with supplies.  

She wants to improve her business with other products that in the future she will include.  She also wants to obtain her own local business establishment where her products can be more accessible to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase a truck-load of green plantains to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luís es soltero y no tiene hijos; vive en la casa de su madre ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona San pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente estudia Comunicación Social en la Universidad, y se dedica a la música ya que percibe ingresos por que trabaja como músico en una banda por más de diez horas. También fleta sus instrumentos los fines de semana, es por eso que solicita el crédito ya que necesita comprar los platillos para la banda donde trabaja y mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos alimenticios, servicios básicos y médicos de su madre, ya que es mayor de edad y no cuentan con seguro médico; Luis  también cubre los gastos de sus estudios de la universidad con los ingresos que percibe.
El sueño de Luís es tener una orquesta completa, para mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
 El trabajo de Luís es muy peligroso por que trabaja por las noches y hasta altas horas de la madrugada ya que los contratos que recibe mayormente son para fiestas nocturnas.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Luís is single and has no children.  He lives in his mother’s house occupying just one small room with a dirt floor; the house is located in the city of La Paz’s San Pedro zone.

He is currently studying Social Communication at the university and earns income working as a musician in a band for more than ten hours.  He also rents out his instruments on the weekend which is why he needs the loan because he needs to by cymbals for the band where he works and to improve his income to cover food, utilities and his mother’s medical expenses because she’s elderly and they don’t have medical insurance.  Luís also covers his university expenses with the income he earns.

Luís’ dream is to have a complete orchestra to improve his income and to help his family.  

Luís’ work is very dangerous because he works nights until the wee hours of the morning because the contracts he gets are mostly for nighttime parties.  This is the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cymbals for his band.

loans.name: Sylviah

texts.en:
Sylviah, 43 years old, is from Kakamega. She is married to Francis and they have two children, aged 10 and 5. For the last 2 years, Sylviah has operated a fish selling business, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Sylviah is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stocks of small fish for sale. Her profits will be used to raise her family's living standards. Sylviah's dream is to have a stable and comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of small fish for sale.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a single mother of three children, all attending school. She takes care of additional family members (a sister). For the past few months, Aida has operated a beauty salon business from her home. She works seven days a week and on all categories of people. Aida generates additional income through selling charcoal.

Aida has applied for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX), which she plans to use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. Her major business challenges are unreliable electricity and the increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. Aida hopes to see her business grow big so that she can own a bridal salon and build her house. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because she wanted to generate more capital. Aida lives in a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes  of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Rudi Alberto

texts.es:
Rudi, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues tiene la oportunidad de aumentar el ganado, comprándose dos terneros, con este préstamo lograra tener los recursos económicos para realizar la compra que será una gran ayuda para él.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue muy positivo, pues ha seguido trabajando con la compra y venta de ganado, dándole una mayor oportunidad de capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rudi is asking for a new loan, since he has the chance to add to his cattle by buying two calves.  With this loan he will gain the economic means to accomplish the purchase, which will be of great help to him.

The previous loan that he received had a very positive effect, since he has continued working in the purchase and sale of cattle, which has given him a greater opportunity for earnings from his work.

loans.use: To purchase two calves.

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es:
José, quiere seguir con las actividades agrícolas, por eso está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la siembra de maíz y frijol (abono y fertilizantes), pues se está preparando para una nueva siembra.
Con el préstamo anterior logro comprarse lo necesario para el cultivo y le dio buenos resultados en la producción de la cosecha, dándole la oportunidad de seguir mejorando su trabajo a través de los créditos, con esto tambien se beneficia su familia.
texts.en:
José wants to continue with agricultural activities, and for that reason he is asking for a loan in order to purchase necessities for planting corn and beans (various fertilizers), since he is preparing for a new crop.

With the previous loan he was able to purchase the necessary items for his crops and he had good results in the production of the harvest, giving him the opportunity to continue improving his work through credits.  This credit will also assist his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus abuelos ocupando solo una habitación pequeña, la casa esta ubicada en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como procurador de tramites con dos abogados, el crédito lo requiere para la elaboración de su tesis de grado ya que actualmente estudia derecho en la Universidad, pero con lo que gana trabajando por más de diez horas no le alcanza para poder pagar sus estudios ya que también cubre los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos, y médicos de sus abuelos.
El sueño que tiene Reynaldo, es independizarse y tener su oficina para tener sus propios clientes y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que el cliente pide préstamo en IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is single and does not have children.  He lives in a just a small room in his grandparents’ house.  The house is in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

He currently gets income because he works as an assistant for two lawyers.  He needs the loan for the production of his postgraduate thesis.  

At the present time he is studying law at the university.  However, what he earns for working over ten hours is not enough to pay for his studies and also cover the expenses of food, basic services, and doctors for his grandparents.

Reynaldo’s dream is to become independent and to have an office in order to have his own clients.  This way he will improve his income and his quality of life.

This is the first time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the production of his postgraduate thesis

loans.name: Fredy Alexander

texts.es:
Fredy, se decide por un nuevo préstamo por que está iniciando nuevamente las labores en la tierra, para esto necesita comprarse los insumos como el abono y herbicidas, tambien pagara el alquiler de terreno, este préstamo le ayudara a darle lo necesario para poder ejecutar su trabajo en la agricultura.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, ayudándose con los materiales que aplico al cultivo de la cual obtuvo una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Fredy has decided to seek a new loan because he is beginning again the working of the land, and for that reason he needs to purchase items like fertilizer and herbicides.  He will also pay the rent for the land.  This loan will help him by providing what is necessary for him to execute his work in agriculture.  The previous loan had a positive effect, helping him with the products that he applied to his crops which allowed him to obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides, and to pay for the rent on his land.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Santa Terecita Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento  Santa Terecita está compuesto por ocho integrantes, cuatro mujeres y cuatro varones, la Presidenta del banco es la Sra. Marcelina tiene 63 años y es casada con un  hijo que ya es independiente, se  dedica a la venta de frutas en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la  ciudad de Cochabamba, la Sra. Marcelina es cliente antigua de la institución ya que este préstamo es su quinta secuencia, la Sra. Marcelina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de frutas por mayor y de temporada, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo para la compra de sus productos, la Sra. Marcelina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, su deseo para su negocio es crecer y ser el distribuidor más grande de la zona, la Sra. Marcelina se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y sus compañeras de grupo. En la foto uno de los socios se encuentra en compañia de su esposa.
texts.en:
The “Santa Terecita” communal bank has 8 members, four women and four men.  The bank’s president is Marcelina, 63.  She’s married and has a son who is independent.  She works selling fruit in one of the city of Cochabamba’s busiest markets.

Marcelina is a longstanding client of the institution since this loan is her fifth sequence.  She is going to use it to buy seasonal fruit at wholesale.  The reason for requesting the loan is the lack of working capital to buy her products.

Marcelina faces business challenges like competition and will use the benefits to improve her quality of life.  Her wish is to see her business grow and to become a major distributor in the zone.  Marcelina feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided her and her fellow group members.

In the photo, one of the members appears with his wife.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Eduardo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque se acerca la temporada de trabajar la agricultura, para esto invertirá en la compra de abono, semilla mejorada, con estos materiales podrá iniciar el cultivo con la esperanza de tener un buen resultado en su producción.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, pues recibió una cosecha buena, aumento la producción del cultivo por utilizar los recursos necesarios, su condición en la familia ha mejorado con los ingresos que él ha aportado.
texts.en:
Eduardo is asking for a new loan because the season to work in agriculture is approaching and he will invest in the purchase of manure and enhanced seeds.  He will be able to start planting with these materials hoping to have good production results.

He had a positive effect from his previous loan because he got a good harvest, increased production by using the necessary resources and his family condition has improved with the income he’s earned.

loans.use: to buy manure and enhanced seeds.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva, es casada y tiene un hijo el cual estudia en la secundaria y tiene 18 años, viven en casa propia  y ocupan solo dos habitaciones pequeñas, la casa esta ubicada en la zona San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz.
Eva se dedica a la fabricación de dulces de sahumerio (ofrendas que se hacen a la madre tierra como agradecimiento) es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar y tintes ya que esto lo utilizan más que todo en los pueblos que dan ofrendas a la tierra.
Actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas al día y solo de lunes a viernes ya que los fines de semana lleva su producto a los pueblos, también cuenta con los ingresos de su esposo que se dedica al transporte urbano y de esta forma ambos cubren los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos y médicos de su familia ya que no cuentan con seguro médico.
El sueño de Eva es ampliar su taller ya que solo ocupa una habitación pequeña para la elaboración de sus productos y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Eva is married and has an 18 year old son attending secondary school.  They live in their own house occupying just two small rooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s San Martín zone.

Eva works manufacturing candy for “sahumerio” (offerings made to show gratitude to Mother Earth) which is why she’s asking for the loan to buy sugar and food coloring since this is what’s used most of all in the towns where offerings to the earth are made.

She’s currently working more than 8 hours daily and only from Monday through Friday because she takes her products to the towns on the weekends.  
She also gets income from her husband who works in urban transportation and this way the two of them can cover food, utilities and medical expenses for the family since they don’t have health insurance.

Eva’s dream is to expand her workshop because she has just one small room to make her products and this way she can improve her income and her quality of life.  This is the second time she’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy candy-making ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five quintals of corn and firewood.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sandra, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir en una tienda de productos domésticos, pues quiere surtirla de todos los productos necesarios para atender la demanda de los clientes como el azúcar, sal, aceite, frijol, pastas, pan, entre otros productos, su intensión es poder tener un negocio rentable.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo tener mejores ingresos y su negocio ha crecido atendiendo mejor las demandas de los clientes, su vida familiar ha mejorado, estabilizando su situación económica.
texts.en:
Sandra is asking for a new loan to invest in her grocery store because she wants to stock it with all the products needed to meet customer demand like sugar, salt, oil, beans, pasta and bread, among other things.  Her goal is to be able to have a profitable business.

With the previous loan she was able to have better income and her business has grown and has been better able to meet customer demand; her family has improved stabilizing her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: 22-Niño Jesus Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento  22- Niño Jesus está compuesto por nuevo integrantes, siete mujeres y dos varones, la Presidenta del banco es la Sra. María tiene 50 años y es casada con un  hijo que tiene la edad de veinte años, ella se dedica a la confección de polleras para las cholitas, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona de la Circunvalación este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  María  utilizara este préstamo para compra te telas por rollo para la confección de sus polleras, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar variedad de prendas de vestir, la Sra. María se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurial Bank, 22-Niño Jesus, is made up of nine members, seven women and two men. The president of the bank is María, who is 50 years old and is married with a 20-year-old son. María works making traditional skirts, and has dedicated her time and efforts to this craft for several years. Her workshop is located in the zone of Circunvalación. This is her second loan with this institution, and she plans to use the support from the loan to purchase rolls of fabric for making skirts. She is requesting this loan because she lacks the working capital to presently make the purchase. 

María faces challenges in her business, and she is constantly working to improve the quality of products she makes. She hopes to utilize her income to continue growing her business and her working capital. Her dream for her business is to keep growing and to master the designs for a wide variety of clothing items. María is grateful to this institution for their support of her business and their support for her fellow group members.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of fabric for making skirts.

loans.name: William Alexander

texts.es:
Willian, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo  porque necesita trabajar en el cultivo de maíz y chile, pues no cuenta con lo necesario en el aspecto económico para comprarse los insumos necesarios como el abono, herbicidas y 1000 plantas de chile.
Él considera que con el aporte del préstamo anterior, aumento la productividad y hubo mejores ganancias a través de este avance, su situación económica ha mejorado; en su hogar no ha enfrentado ningún problema.
texts.en:
William is asking for a new loan because he needs to work growing corn and chilies because he does not have what’s needed from an economic standpoint to buy the supplies needed like manure, herbicide and 1000 chili plants.

He feels that with the previous loan he increased production and profits improved by means of this advance.  His economic situation has improved and he’s had no problems at home.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide and 1000 chili plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 30 years old. He works as a blacksmith and has 10 years' experience in the field. Omar intends to expand his blacksmith lab and his production of doors and iron windows, so he asked Ryada for a youth loan of $2,000.

Omar has 2 children and lives with his family in Gaza. His dream is to expand his lab, which will allow him to fill more orders for his products. This will increase his income, which he plans to use to educate his sons in the future and to help his children achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to expand his lab.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga, 22 years old, is married and has 2 children, ages 1 and 3. She is involved in fishing and earns a living selling fresh fish to her community. Dominga also processes dried fish to sell. She has applied for a loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. Dominga desires to have a bigger business. She hopes for this loan to help improve her sales and profitability.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline, 42 years old, is the mother of three children aged between 6 and 18 years old. She is married to Alex and they hail from Kakamega.

For the last 10 years, Jacquiline has operated a milk sales business, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000. She is now taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stocks of milk for sale and supplies for her customers. Her profits will be used to repay the loan. Jacquiline's dream is to expand her milk selling business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of milk.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is the father of four children, three of whom are enrolled in school. For the last 5 years, he has operated cereal and poultry businesses. His primary customers are passersby and hotel operators. He dreams of hiring employees in the future. Rahab describes high transportation costs to be his major challenge. He plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase some chicks and chicken feed.

Rahab owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase some chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: 2012 Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “2012” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; Repostería, podología, artesanía en tejido, venta de carbón, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valdivia.
Alejandra presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en segunda fila al fondo de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta negra, aros blancos y su cabello esta tomado hacia el lado.
Ella se dedica al rubro venta de ropa de mujer y perfumes, se ocupa de su negocio hace 30 años. Su mercadería en ropa es diversa, ya que generalmente sus productos son para todas las edades.
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en Santiago por internet. Con el crédito comprara chalecos de mujeres de diferentes modelos y diferentes tallas.
Sus metas son ampliar su negocio, comprando diversos productos para tener más clientela y así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Alejandra vive junto a su marido quien se desempeña como Funcionario Público y 3 hijos pequeños. Sus sueños son poder tener una casa propia.
Alejandra está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal ya que existe respeto y son unidos.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “2012”.  It is made up of 15 entrepreneurs who are involved in different economic activities.  These include: baking, podiatry, textile handicrafts, selling charcoal, services and other activities.  All of the members are originally from the city of Valdivia.

Alejandra is the group’s president.  In the photo she is the second woman from the right in the front row, and is wearing a black jacket and white earrings with her hair parted to one side.  Alejandra makes a living selling women’s clothing and perfumes, and has been involved in this business for 30 years.  She sells a diverse range of clothing, as her products are generally for women of all ages.  She normally buys her merchandise online in Santiago.  

Alejandra will use the loan to purchase women’s sweaters in different styles and sizes.  She plans to expand her business by buying a variety of products so she can have a larger clientele and thus achieve a better quality of life.  Alejandra lives with her husband, who is a government official, and their 3 small children.  Her dream is to own a house.

Alejandra is very happy and grateful for the loan and services that Fondo Esperanza has provided.  She says that she feels very comfortable being part of her communal bank, since the members are very close and respectful toward one another.  

Chillán is a city in the south-central part of Chile.  Its name means “the chair of the sun” in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuche people.  Chillán is known as the “Cradle of the Country” or the “Land of Artists”, as many important figures in the history of Chile were born in the city, such as the famous pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to purchase women’s sweaters in different styles and sizes.

loans.name: Olga De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Olga, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues se le presento la oportunidad de invertir más en el negocio, pues comprara verduras frescas como tomates, cebollas, papas, chiles y otras verduras para aumentar el negocio.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar las condiciones del negocio, recibiendo mayores beneficios, pues sus clientes aumentaron, su demanda y sus ganancias, su familia no ha crecido, pero si sus condiciones económicas son mejores.
texts.en:
Olga has decided on a new loan because the opportunity to invest more in the business arose because she will buy fresh vegetables like tomatoes, onions, potatoes, chilies and others to increase business.

She states that the previous loan helped her to improve her business conditions and she earned higher profits because her clientele grew as well as demand and profits.   Her family hasn’t increased but her economic condition is better.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Lissy Prissyla

texts.es: La Srta, Lissy Prissyla, tiene 21 años de edad, ella es estudiante de la carrera de Laboratorio Clínico en un Instituto local, ella tiene un hijo pequeño quien es el motor y motivo de todo su esfuerzo y ansias de progresar, es la mejor de su clase y solicita el crédito para costear el gasto de unos cursos complementarios necesarios para el mejor desempeño de su carrera de Laboratorio Clínico.
texts.en: Lissy Prissyla is 21 years old and studying the career of Clinical Laboratory in a local institute.  She has a small son who is the motor and motivation for all her efforts and for her drive to succeed.  She’s at the top of her class and is asking for the loan to pay for complementary courses that are needed for the better performance of her clinical laboratory career.

loans.use: to pay course fees.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Doña Judith, es viuda, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 36 a 50 años. Su historia de negocios inicia desde hace 25 años, cuando su capacidad creativa le indicó una actividad con la cual desarrollar su potencial y generar ingresos; así fue como organizó su propio taller y con ello logró mantenerse por cuenta propia y apoyar el bienestar de su hogar. Doña Judith, no le gusta depender de su familia y vive orgullosa de saber que a sus 74 años de edad, aun produce dinero, apoya a 3 nietos en sus estudios universitarios y ruega a Dios que le de vida y salud para verlos convertidos en profesionales triunfadores. Su negocio consiste en elaborar trapeadores y también ropa en las diferentes líneas, así como en vender mercancía variada. Su clientela está conformada por referidos de sus clientes alrededor de su barrio y en zonas aledañas. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local y sacar su negocio a un lugar más estratégico para lograr incrementar su mercado de clientes y justamente este es  su mayor desafío.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas, para confeccionar ropa femenina que tiene encargada, materias primas para elaborar traperos y aumentar la producción en la proporción de su crecimiento y exigencia del mercado de clientes y comprará mercancía variada para tener un inventario que responda a la celebración de la fecha de mayor movimiento comercial de las mercancías femeninas, como lo es el día de las madres. Con toda esta estrategia visualizamos el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Judith is a widow living in the city of Cartagena; she has four children whose ages range between 36 and 50 years.  Her business history started 25 years ago when her creative capacity led her to an activity she could use to develop her potential and to generate income.  This was how she organized her own workshop and with it has managed to support herself by her own means and to support her home’s wellbeing.

Judith doesn’t like to depend on her family and lives proud to know that at the age of 74 she’s still producing money.  She helps support three grandchildren’s university expenses and she prays to God that He gives her life and health to see them become successful professionals.

Her business consists in manufacturing mops and also various lines of clothing as well as selling assorted merchandise.  Her clientele is composed of referrals from customers around her neighborhood and adjacent zones.  Her goal for later on is to have a locale and to move her business to a more strategically located spot to increase her market of customers and this is precisely her greatest challenge.

At present, she’s applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy fabric to make women’s clothes she has on order and raw materials to make the mops and to increase production in the same ratio her clientele and marked demand has grown; she will also buy varied merchandise to have inventory on hand to respond to the May celebration which means the biggest sales in women’s articles: Mother’s Day.  This strategy allows us at FMSD to visualize success for this investment.

loans.use: to buy sewing and mop-making supplies.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Sencilla y amable, así es la señora Benedicta de 34 años de edad. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julio, de 41 años, y durante varios años de casados tuvieron a sus cuatro hijos, a quienes les brindan una buena educación para que sean hombres de bien en el futuro. 

Durante 19 años se dedicó a la venta de abarrotes como;  arroz, azúcar, conservas, bebidas, golosinas, entre otras. Esta labor la realiza en el puesto del mercado de su localidad y siempre cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, como también de su esposo. Ella comenta que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder atender con amabilidad a los clientes; ya que es la manera de poder ganarse la confianza de las personas. En esta labor siempre tiene que estar pendiente, porque siendo así obtiene buenos ingresos de la venta que realiza.
Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y sean profesionales, es por eso que día a día es constante para mantener buenas ganancias. 

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo económico para seguir cumpliendo con sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo, se siente dichosa de laborar con compañeros responsables en su banco comunal.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, Benedicta podrá abastecerse de mercadería para implementar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Kind and unassuming is Benedicta, 34.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Julio, 41.  During the years of their marriage they have had four children who they provide a good education for so that they will become upstanding citizens in the future.

For 9 years she worked selling groceries like rice, sugar, conserves, soft-drinks and snacks, among others.  She carries out this work in a market stand in her location and always has her children’s support as well as her husband’s.  

She comments that what she most likes about her work is being able to treat her customers kindly since this is the way of winning over people’s trust; she always has to be vigilant because this is how good income from sales is attained.  Her greatest wish is that her children finish their schooling and become professionals and this is why she tries to earn good profits consistently every day.

This is loan #6 with MFP and she feels grateful for the economic support to continue meeting her business goals.  She also feels fortunate to work with responsible fellow members of her communal bank.  She will use the 2000 new soles to stock up on merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Frine

texts.es:
Frine tiene 32 años, vive con Marcelino, de 34 años, y sus dos hijos en su casa propia, la cual compraron durante varios años de relación de convivencia.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora, siempre se esmera por dar lo mejor a su familia. Su actividad principal es el cultivo de café, lo cual realiza durante 20 años con la ayuda de su pareja. A ella le gusta ir constantemente a su parcela, y desde muy temprano está pendiente de la producción de sus plantas. Frine comenta que le gusta más ir los fines de semana, ya que lo hace junto a sus hijos; lo que no le gusta es cuando baja el precio del café, porque siendo así no le alcanza para poder solventar los gastos que realiza en los estudios de sus hijos. Es por ello que acude a las oficinas de MFP para solicitar un préstamo que le ayude a resolver los problemas que le aquejan.
De esta forma podrá comprar más plantas de café, pues esto le ayudará a que su producción sea mayor y no le ocasione problemas cuando baje el precio.

Éste es su préstamo número 2 con MFP y se siente contenta por el apoyo que le brindan. En su banco comunal es una persona muy activa y solidaria. 
Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más plantas de café para poder cultivar en su parcela.
texts.en:
Frine, 32, lives with Marcelino, 34, and their two children in her own house that they bought over several years of living together as a couple.

She is a hardworking woman who always strives to give her family the best.  Her main activity is growing coffee which she’s been doing for 20 years with help from her spouse.  She likes constantly going to her fields and starts watching over her plants very early.  

Frine comments that what she likes best is going on weekends because she does it with her children.  What she doesn’t like is when the price of coffee drops because then she can’t cover the expenses generated by her children’s schooling.  This is why she calls on the MFP offices to ask for a loan to solve the problems that harass her.  She will be able to buy more coffee plants this way which will help her to increase production thus avoiding problems when the price drops.

This is loan #2 with MFP and she feels happy for the support they give her.  She’s a very active, supportive member of her communal bank.  She will use the money she’s asking for now to buy more coffee plants to grow on her parcel.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Dewis Enrique

texts.es: Dewis  de 34 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tienen una pequeña remontadora de  calzado dirigida a todos los miembros de su familia; negocio que inició para desarrollar su libre y emprendedor espíritu de trabajo, pues llegó a  la ciudad de Cartagena hace 5 años, desde Santa Ana Magdalena y con muchas ganas de trabajar; así fue como inició su vida laboral empleado en una tienda en su barrio y cuando  reunió  poco a poco dinero  para ser independiente  y  había aprendido a tratar con clientes, decidió aplicar los conocimiento de reparación de calzado a un negocio, que le generara su propio sustento, el cual  desarrolla con mucha alegría, tal como lo muestra en la fotografía. Él se encuentra ubicado en una chaza, sitio estratégico donde es muy reconocido por los residentes del sector. Pero no solamente Dewis remonta calzado para damas, caballeros y niños, sino que también muy  temprano vende café y productos de cigarrería en la terraza de una tienda, tiene para ello 18 termos que adquirió poco a poco producto de su trabajo de remontar  calzado. Su meta mas adelante es mejorar las condiciones de su remontadora y crecer con maquinarias y equipos, así mismo adecuar su infraestructura de venta de café,  para que cuando organice su familia esté todo dispuesto para brindarle bienestar y ser aun más feliz. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales de trabajo como pegante, puntillas, suelas etc, así como también comprará mas termos y aprovechará esta inversión para tener una nueva  y elegante carretilla, con la cual impactará su mercado. Su credikiva tendrá éxito porque hoy es un gran desafío acceder a un capital de trabajo alterno y suficiente para invertir y con su credikiva responderá a su ascendente crecimiento, mejorará las condiciones de su servicio, tendrá una mejor presentación en su imagen de calidad y seguridad y  fidelizará nuevos clientes, convirtiéndolos así en asiduos compradores de sus productos y servicios que son su objetivo principal.
texts.en:
Dewis, 34, lives in the city of Cartagena.  He has a small cobbler shop run for all the members of his family, a business that he started so he could develop his free and entrepreneurial work spirit.  He arrived in Cartagena five years ago from Santa Ana Magdalena with a great desire to work.

He started his work life as an employee in a neighborhood store.  When he got together his money little by little to be independent and he had learned how to deal with customers, he decided to apply his knowledge of shoe repair to a business that would generate his own means of support.  He does this with great happiness, just as the photo shows.

He is located in an informal stall, a strategic place where he is well recognized by the residents of the area.  Not only does Dewis repair shoes for women, men, and children, very early in the day he also sells coffee and tobacco products on the terrace of a store.  For this he has 18 thermoses that he acquired little by little, the result of his work as a cobbler.

His long-term goal is to improve the conditions of his cobbler business and to grow with machinery and equipment.  He also will adapt his infrastructure so that when he organizes his family everything is ready to give them well-being and to be even happier.

Currently he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan he has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it he will buy work materials such as adhesive, molds, soles, etc.  He also will buy more thermoses and will make the most of this investment to have a new and elegant cart with which he will impress his market.

His Kiva loan will be successful because today it is a big challenge to get enough alternative working capital to invest.  With his Kiva loan he will respond to his rising growth, improve his service, better present the quality and security of his image, and cultivate new customers, converting them into devoted buyers of his products and services.  These are his main goals.

loans.use: to buy adhesive, molds, soles, etc., as well as thermoses and a new cart.

loans.name: John

texts.es:
John tiene 35 años, es padre de una hermosa niña de nombre Katerin, de 11 años. Su esposa es Ruth, de 35 años; juntos viven en su casa propia hecha a base de material noble.

Con mucha amabilidad y cortesía John atiende a sus clientes en su puesto de venta de abarrotes, la cual es su principal actividad y la que conoce hace 12 años. Este trabajo lo hace junto a su esposa, quien lo anima cada día para seguir adelante y obtener una buena calidad de vida para la familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder complacer a sus clientes con los productos que les ofrece. Esta actividad es lo que mejor sabe hacer John, y por ello recurre a los créditos podrá implementarse de mercadería.

Este es su crédito número 13 con MFP, y asegura que seguirá siendo puntual con sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo agradece a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por ser responsables y solidarios. 
Con los 3,500 nuevos soles que ahora solicita podrá comprar sacos de arroz y azúcar, bebidas, verduras y otros víveres para su tienda.
texts.en:
John, 35, is the father of a beautiful, 11 year old girl, Katerin.  His wife is Ruth, 35.  They all live together in their own house that’s built of substantial materials.

With much kindness and courtesy, John tends to his customers at his grocery store which is his main activity and one he’s been in for 12 years.  He does this work alongside his wife who encourages him every day to move forward and obtain a good quality of life for the family.

What he likes best about his work is being able to please his customers with the products he offers them.  This activity is what John knows how to do best and this is why he turns to loans to be able to stock up on merchandise.

This is his loan #13 with MFP and he assures that he will continue to be punctual with his installment payments.  He also is grateful to his fellow communal bank members for being responsible and mutually supportive.

He will use the 3500 new soles he’s asking for now to buy sacks of rice and sugar, soft-drinks, vegetables and other foodstuffs for his store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elisa Luz

texts.es:
Elida es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 50 años pero tiene el espíritu de una joven de 20 años, a su lado vive su esposo el cual trabaja como seguridad en el municipio de su barrio, asimismo juntos tiene un pequeño de 7 años, a quien ama mucho y sobre todo se esfuerza cada día junto a su esposo por darle una buena calidad de vida y mucho amor. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor en cualquier época del años, también en el encontramos a la alguna de Huacachina la cual se encuentra en medio de espectaculares dunas y recibe a muchos turistas en todo el año. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión y en ocasiones leer un libro, también aprovecha la oportunidad para preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos e cual es el riquísimo Escabeche de pollo. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería.

Con mucho entusiasmo Elida trabaja en su negocio de venta de gaseosas, huevos y ropa; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diaria y puede atender hasta  10 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque los clientes la conocen y sobre todo los trata de manera amable y entusiasta.

Elida esta my agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, entre otros así como también realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Con esta mejora tendrá mayor variedad de productos para sus clientes y también mejorara su calidad de vida, así ella seguirá esforzándose cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Elida is a very hardworking woman. She’s 50 years old but has the spirit of a 20-year-old.  Her husband lives by her side; he works in security in their neighborhoods municipality.  They have a little 7 year old boy who she loves very much and strives daily alongside her husband to give him a good quality of life and much love.

Her house is located in the city of Ica, a city noted for its year-round hot, welcoming climate.  The Huacachina Lagoon is also found there; it’s surrounded by spectacular dunes and is visited by many tourists all year.

When she has free time she enjoys watching television and on occasion to read a book; she also takes advantage of the opportunity to prepare one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Escabeche de Pollo.”  She only attended secondary school but would have liked to have studied Nursing.

With much enthusiasm Elida works in her store selling soft-drinks, eggs and clothes.  She spends about 8 hours daily there and can tend to up to 10 customers per day.  She believes that she does well in her business because the customers know her and above all because she treats them kindly and enthusiastically.

Elida is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy more merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles and canned goods, among others as well as to do some home improvements.  With this improvement she’ll have a wider variety of goods for her customers and also will improve her quality of life so she can continue striving every day to make her greatest dream a reality:  to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and to do home improvements.

loans.name: Cleofe Cecilia

texts.es:
Cleofe es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre de un pequeño de 3 años el cual cursa actualmente educación inicial; para Cleofe este pequeño es el regalo más grande que le ha dado Dios y por el cual ella trabaja con mucho ánimo para darle una buena calidad de vida y sobre todo amor; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, así como también por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz y también por los riquísimos camarones. Cuando dispone  de un tiempo libre a Cleofe le gusta mirar películas y aprovecha también para preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”.

Con mucha alegría Cleofe trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes en la pequeña bodega que tiene en su vivienda; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio  porque es amable y sobre todo atenta con os clientes.

Cleofe está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (Arroz, azúcar, enlatados, entre otros) así como también mejorar el piso de su negocio, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y dar más comodidad a los clientes; así  ella podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Darle la mejor educación a su hijo y que su negocio crezca”.
texts.en:
Cleofe’s a very hardworking woman; she’s the mother of a little three-year-old who attends nursery school.  For Cleofe this little one is the greatest gift God has given her and for whom she works with much dedication to give him a good quality of life and above all love.

Her house is located in the city of Camana, a city noted for its beautiful beaches as well as for its agriculture, especially rice growing; also for its very delicious shrimp.  When she has free time available, Cleofe likes to watch movies and also takes advantage of it to prepare one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Arroz Chaufa.”

Cleofe works with much joy selling groceries in the small store she has at home.  She spends about 10 hours daily at work and can see up to 30 customers per day.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s kind and above all attentive to her customers.

Cleofe is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her store (rice, sugar, canned goods, among others) as well as to improve the floor in the store which will lead to improved income and more customer comfort so that she can continue striving to make her greatest dream a reality: to give her son the best education and that he business grows.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Mariano Victoriano

texts.es:
Mariano Victoriano tiene 85 años de edad es solero, vive con su primo en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. 

Es Integrante de la Vrc Balacelo queda a  10 minutos de la oficina  en esta Ventanilla son integrantes 10 miembros. Se cambio de ventanilla por que tuvo un desacuerdo con un miebro de la otra ventanilla.
Mariano Victoriano se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frejol.
Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el frejol como urea, abono y liquido para mata hierba.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos necesarios que permita tener cosechas y mejores ingresos. 
Las compras y las ventas  de los productos lo realizan con frecuencia en el Cantón Chillanes cada ocho días.
El sueño es mejorar las cosechas con los abonos necesarios que va a comprar para tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mariano Victoriano is 85 years old.  He is single, and lives with his cousin in the Chillanes cantón in Bolívar province.  He belongs to the rural communal bank Balacelo, which has ten members.

Mariano Victoriano work in agriculture, growing corn and beans.

He is requesting the loan to be able to purchase the necessary supplies that will allow him to have better harvests and improved income.

He makes his purchases of supplies and sells his products on a frequent basis in the Chillanes cantón.  He does this weekly.

His dream is to improve his harvests with the necessary fertilizers, which he will buy in order to have greater income.

loans.use: to purchase urea, fertilizer, and insecticides

loans.name: Mercedes Melina

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo entusiasta, tiene 36 años de edad, madre de de 2 hijos, cuyas edades comprende 18 y 8 años, a quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes siempre se ha esforzado mucho para sacarlos adelante ya que los ha criado sola porque el padre de sus hijos la abandono y desde ese entonces se convirtió en padre y madre para ellos. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor en cualquier época del años, también en el encontramos a la alguna de Huacachina la cual se encuentra en medio de espectaculares dunas y recibe a muchos turistas en todo el año. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música así como también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar computación e informática.

Día a día Mercedes sale a trabajar en su negocio de venta de productos naturales, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad.

Mercedes está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá mas mercadería para su negocio y podrá comprar una cocina, con esta mejora podrá tener más variedad de productos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida, así ella seguirá trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a hard-working and above all, enthusiastic woman.  She is 36 years old, mother of two children, ages 18 and 8.  She loves her children very much and has always worked very hard to get them ahead.  She has been raising the children alone because their father left her and since then, she has become both father and mother to them.  Her home is located in Ica, a city known for having a warm and welcoming climate at any time of year. Ica is also the home of the Huacachina Lagoon which sits amidst spectacular sand dunes and receives many tourists throughout the year.  When she has free time, she enjoys listening to music and eating one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Carapulcra” (a spicy Peruvian stew with freeze-dried potatoes).  She only completed a high school education but would have liked to study computer science and information technology.  

Day by day, Mercedes goes out to work in her business, selling natural products.  She dedicates about nine hours a day to her business and may serve up to twenty customers per day.  She believes that her business is going well because she is very friendly toward her customers and most importantly, she offers quality products.

Mercedes is very grateful for the Kiva loans because thanks to the help they have provided, she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business and buy a stove.  With this improvement, she will have a wider variety of products and be able to improve her quality of life.  In this way, she will continue working toward making her great dream a reality: “To provide her children with a good education”.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and a stove.

loans.name: Rawad

texts.en:
Rawad is a 26-year-old Lebanese man. After getting married, he moved to live with his wife and school-aged child. He’s trying the best he can to enhance his family’s way of life. For that reason, Rawad opened his own flower shop in 2005. He has a wide variety of flowers and wedding decorations. 

Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy the needed quantity of flowers for his shop and other decoration items. This will certainly increase the number of customers asking for his service. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop by adding diverse kinds of flowers.

loans.use: to buy the needed quantity of flowers for his shop and other decoration items

loans.name: Litiz Dunia

texts.es:
La socia Dunia nació en la ciudad de Juliaca del departamento de Puno pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos. La socia Dunia y su esposo tiene un pequeño taller mecánico donde ella desempeña la labor de administradora del negocio.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Dunia requiere el préstamo para comprar lubricantes y aceites. 
  
La socia Dunia pertenece al banco comunal “San Antonio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en: Dunia was born in the city of Juliaca, department of Puno but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  She is 37 years old, married, and has two children from this union.  Dunia and her husband have a small mechanic shop where she manages the business.  They have dedicated several years to the business already and it’s going very well thanks to the determination that she puts into her job.  Dunia is requesting the loan to purchase lubricants and oil.  She is a member of the San Antonio Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association located in Cusco province.

loans.use: to purchase lubricants and oil.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Ek is 54 and a married woman. She lives with her family in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Ek is a loving mother of six children, five of whom are still single, while the oldest one has started his own family. Ek and her husband have worked hard in the rice farming business to raise their children and ensure a good living standard. This couple transplants their rice crops twice a year because their business location is not too far from the water supply of the commune.

To upgrade the family's standard of living, Ek now would like to receive a loan of KHR 1,600,000 from HKL to build a bathroom and a toilet for home use. The loan will enable her to ensure a healthy condition for her family. Ek dreams of having a comfortable house someday and she wants save some of her income to renovate her house.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and a toilet for home use.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a divorced woman with a single child who is attending school. She has been operating a grocery business for the past four years and she aspires to open a kiosk in future. Mercy sells her goods at the market, mostly to the local residents. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. With the loan of KES 30,000 she plans to purchase bananas, tomatoes, and onions. Seasonality is the major challenge facing her business, especially during the dry season, when there is scarcity of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Celia Argentina

texts.es: La señora Celia , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su hijos ya todos casados e independiente, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Celia es una mujer luchadora , con muchas ganas de superarse y sueña que cuando sea viejita pueda gozar con sus nietos en una casa digna , ya que donde habita tiene varios hoyos el techo y en tiempos de lluvia parece pazcón y toda el agua se le pasa a la vivienda ocasionando daños dentro de la misma , la gran dificultad de doña Celia es que no cuenta con otro recurso económico más que el de su arduo trabajo como estilista domiciliar , donde trabaja tres veces por semana. El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de Zinc , perlines , bloques y cemento .Agradece la confianza y el apoyo de Afodenic atravez de los fondos Kiva .
texts.en:
Sra. Celia is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe. All of her children are married and independent. Her plans for the future include making improvements to her living conditions. Doña Celia is a determined woman has tremendous drive to succeed. She dreams of having a decent home in her old age so that she can enjoy her grandchildren. There are several holes in the roof of her house, so water is able to seep through when it rains and it has caused occasional damage to the rest of her house.

Doña Celia's greatest difficulty is having no other financial resources since she already works hard as a beautician in her home, a job that she performs three times a week. This loan will be used to buy zinc, crossbeams, blocks, and cement. She is grateful for the trust and support that AFODENIC has demonstrated by providing Kiva funds.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia Cleofe nació en la ciudad de Combapata del departamento de Apurímac y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Clofe es la venta de comida y tambien se dedica a la venta de golosinas y otras cosas más, ella vende de forma ambulatoria y tiene un puesto de venta  en la calle. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

La socia Cleofe requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar.   
  
La socia Cleofe pertenece al banco comunal “San Antonio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
The associate Cleofe was born in the city of Combapata in the region of Apurímac and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  She is 42 years old and is married and the fruit of this relation are four children.  Her principle economic activity is the sale of food and also she works selling candies and other things.  She works as a walking saleswoman and has a stall on the street.  She has been working in this area for several years and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

Cleofe is asking for a loan in order to purchase more basic food products like sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.
  
Cleofe belongs to the communal bank "San Antonio" of the Arariwa Association of the province of Cusco.

loans.use: To purchase more basic food products.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, pues tiene la intensión de mejorar la atención a los clientes ofreciéndoles medicamentos en mayor proporción para sus enfermedades, él comprara una diversidad de medicamentos en presentaciones de pastillas, jarabes, ampollas.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para fortalecer el negocio y tener mayor presencia en las zonas, esto le ayudo grandemente para mejorar sus ingresos familiares, y que su negocio vaya creciendo.
texts.en: José has decided to request a new loan, since he has the intention of improving services for his clients by offering them medicines in larger quantities for their illnesses.  He will buy a variety of medicines in the form of pills, syrups and ampoules (small sealed vials).  He believes that the previous loan helped him to strengthen his business and to have a greater presence in the zone.  This helped him greatly to increase his household income and it helped his business grow.

loans.use: to buy a variety of medicines in the form of pills, syrups and ampoules (small sealed vials).

loans.name: Faviola

texts.es:
Faviola, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en una casa alquilada en la zona  Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz. Actualmente obtiene ingresos por las ventas de ropa deportiva de forma ambulante por que no cuenta con un puesto fijo, trabaja muchas horas bajo muchos peligros en las calles ya sea por robos o accidentes de transito.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería ya que desea  comprar más ropa deportiva y ponerlas  a la venta.
El sueño de Faviola, es tener su puesto fijo y mejorar sus ingresos para la manutención de su hijo ya que es la única que aporta  con los gastos en su familia. 
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Faviola is a single mother and has one son. They lives in a rented house in the District of Chijini in the city of La Paz. She currently earns income by selling sportswear as a street vendor since she has no established location. Faviola works many hours under dangerous conditions that exist in the streets, such as robberies and traffic accidents.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise, such as sportswear, so that she will have goods to sell. Faviola's dream is to have an established vending post so that she can improve her earnings for supporting her son. She is the only one providing for the expenses of her family.

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more sportswear.

loans.name: Diana Marisol

texts.es:
Diana, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, pues considera que el comercio debe tener movimientos en la inversión, para ofrecer a los clientes nuevos estilos, ella comprara ropa nueva como blusas, faldas, pantalones, short.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ha ayudado mucho para trabajar, pues su negocio ha permanecido estable con mercadería para atender las demandas de los clientes, en su familia las condiciones económicas ha ido mejorando.
texts.en:
Diana has decided to request a new loan for the purchase of merchandise for her business, since she believes that her business should have movement and investment in products.  In order to offer her clients the latest styles, she will buy new clothing like blouses, skirts, pants and shorts.  

She affirms that the previous loan helped her very much in her work, since her business has remained stable with merchandise to meet the demands of clients, and in her family the economic situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants and shorts.

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en: Elpedio is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has children. Elpedio started fishing 13 years ago and earns 5,000 PHP monthly from it. Elpedio works hard to improve his business and to be able to send his children to school. He has requested a loan to purchase a fishing boat and fishing nets. Elpedio hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, 39 years old, is from Kakamega. She is married to Paul and they have two children, aged 2 years and 1 month. For the last 4 years, Alice has operated a photocopying business, earning a monthly income of KES 5,100. She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy photocopying papers and other stationery. Alice's profits will be reinvested in the business. Her dream is to have a good and comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy photocopying papers and other stationery.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is married and has 4 children, all attending school. She has two additional family members. For the last 10 years, Dorothy has operated a pub, working from home on a retail basis. She works six days a week. Dorothy has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin.

Dorothy's major business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her customers from coming to her, and transportation. She hopes to own a fully stocked pub and to build a commercial house. Dorothy lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more beer, soda and local gin

loans.name: Noorey

texts.en: Noorey, 26 years old, is from Kakamega. She is single and currently supports no one. For the last 4 years, Noorey has operated a clothing sales business, selling mostly new clothing. She makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. Noorey is currently taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more clothing to sell. Her profits will be used to improve her stock capacity. Noorey's dream is to open business outlets for clothing.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en: Hanaa is a 58-year-old Lebanese widow, with one working child. In 2000, she started her own home business, and she works nonstop. Hanaa decorates chocolate for all events. Her job is independent, based upon customers' requests. She would like to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added decoration products in order to carry out her work properly. In the future, she plans to have her own chocolate shop.

loans.use: to purchase added decoration products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds for cashews.

loans.name: Wilfredo Cristobal

texts.es:
Wilfredo, solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos series de billetes de lotería, este préstamo le ayudara a poder continuar en el negocio, pues él y su familia dependen de sus ganancias, Wilfredo considera que trabajar con préstamos le ha permitido estabilizarse y poderse hacer un historial de crédito.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo una buena experiencia, logro cancelar las cuotas respectivas y su clientela a aumentado.
texts.en: Wilfredo is asking for a loan to purchase two series of lottery tickets.  This loan will help him to be able to continue with the business, since he and his family depend on his income.  Wilfredo believes that working with the loans has allowed him to establish himself and to be able to get a credit history.  With the previous loan he had a good experience.  He was able to meet his loan repayments and his clientele has increased.

loans.use: To purchase two series of lottery tickets.

loans.name: Marlene Yanet

texts.es:
Marlene, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para surtir mas el negocio, comprara blusas, pantalones, faldas, calcetines y demás ropa interior, con esta inversión espera tener buenos resultados en las ventas.
Ella manifiesta hacer tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, sus ventas mejoraron y ha agregado otros rubros al negocio, de los cuales ha recibido mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Marlene is requesting a new loan to stock her business.  She will buy blouses, pants, skirts, socks, and underwear.  With this investment, she hopes to have good results with her sales.
