She expressed that her previous loan has had a positive effect on her business.  Her sales improved, and she has added other items to her business, from which she has received better profits.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, skirts, socks, and underwear.

loans.name: Zorig

texts.en:
Zorig, 44 years old, is married and has 4 children. He lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar's outer ger district, which lacks basic infrastructure. His elder son is a soldier and his other three children attend high school. 

Zorig is a very experienced driver who worked in Japan. He operates a network business with his wife and their monthly income is 500,000 - 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT).  

The family's current house is very old and unsafe, so Zorig wants to rebuild it. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials. Zorig says, “During summertime, it’s very possible to build a house.”

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and only child, who is still attending school. Wissam has owned a coffee booth in his town since 2007. He also travels from one village to another, responding to his clients’ demands. Even though he spends most of his time working, Wissam knows that, in the end, he’s offering a fair way of living to his family and this is what he cares about most. Wissam is now asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more coffee for his business. He notes that this will improve his financial situation. In the future, Wissam plans to have his own coffee shop.

loans.use: to purchase more coffee for his business

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo, en esta ocasión será utilizado en la compra de mariscos, para surtir el negocio, realizando compras periódicas, comprara mas pescado, camarones y también comprara productos de revistas para mantener en el negocio cosmeticos y poder ofrecer a los clientes.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ayudándole a mejorar las ventas de camarón, con sus ganancias ha comprado artículos para el hogar y ha pagado las cuotas del préstamo, generándole mayor estabilidad.
texts.en: Juana is asking for a new loan.  On this occasion it will be used to purchase seafood in order to supply her business.  She will make periodic purchases and will purchase fish, shrimp and also will purchase products from magazines in order to maintain her cosmetics business and be able to offer more to her clients.  The previous loan that she received had a positive effect, helping her to improve the sales of shrimp.  With her earnings she has purchased articles for her home and has paid off the loan, generating greater stability.

loans.use: to purchase fish, shrimp and also to purchase products from magazines

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mariscos, semilla de marañón cruda, con esto surtirá el negocio y podrá mejorar el servicio  a los clientes, con este préstamo esta agregando el rubro de la semilla de marañón, espera mejorar sus ingresos de esta manera.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, compro un coche para movilizarse con la venta, esto le ha ayudado a mejorar para poder accesar a otras zonas, sus ingresos incrementaron, en su familia ha empezado a construir otra pequeña vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa has decided to request a new loan in order to purchase shellfish and raw cashew nut seeds. These will add variety to the business and improve customer service. With this loan, Rosa is adding the cashew seeds as a product and thus hopes to improve her earnings. 

Rosa's previous loan had a positive effect. She purchased a car in order to mobilize her sales and this has helped her to be able to reach other regions. Her earnings increased and her family has begun to construct an additional small dwelling.

loans.use: to purchase shellfish and raw cashew nut seeds.

loans.name: Sylviah

texts.en:
Sylviah is the mother of three children, all enrolled in school. She is married to a teacher who supports her working to provide another source of income. Sylviah lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and rent.

For the last 8 years, Sylviah has been operating a retail charcoal sales business. She dreams of hiring some employees in the future to assist her in the day-to-day operation of her business. Sylviah plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 29 years old, is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is also a farmer.

Jocelyn and her husband work together in cultivating their land to grow rice crops. They also started providing organic spray for mango trees. Jocelyn does her best to improve their business and take care of her children. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds and to pay for tractor rental. Jocelyn hopes to have enough money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds and to pay for tractor rental

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia, 44 years old, is a single woman who supports four children aged 4, 11, 13 and 18. For the last 18 years, Sophia has operated a tailoring business, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is now taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy textile materials. Sophia will reinvest her anticipated profits back into the business. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy textile materials.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 35 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con dos hijos a  su cargo, Vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hijos, en el  Distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura. Además cuentan con los  servicios básicos  de luz, agua y desagüe. Así mismo la actividad de la zona es la Agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.

La actividad  principal que desarrolla Luis es la Agricultura  donde tiene sembrado plantaciones de limón y a la vez viene cosechando semanalmente y lo comercializa a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace más de 10 años y cuenta con experiencia en este rubro; su cónyuge se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral  y  lo apoya en toda  actividad que realiza. 

El monto solicitado por Luis es de S/. 1,000 nuevos soles y será para  la compra de Fertilizantes de su cultivo y alimento balanceado para las aves.; y de esta forma seguir  creciendo en su negocio, lo cual le permite mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a 35 year old man who is married and has two children. He lives in his own house with his wife and children in the district of Tambogrande in the region of Piura. They have basic services such as electricity, water, and sewer.

The main activities of the region are agriculture, the raising of livestock, and business. Luis principally focuses on agriculture and he has seeded plantations of lemons. He harvests weekly and sells his product to the major businesses of the region. He has been developing this activity for more than 10 years and has a lot of experience in this field. His wife raises poultry and supports him in everything he does.

Luis is requesting this loan for 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles in order to purchase fertilizers for his crops and balanced food for the birds. With this he will be able to continue growing his business and thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his crops and balanced food for his animals.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is a single woman who has been selling clothes in a shop for the last year. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She aspires to hire some employees in the future, and she describes seasonality to be her major challenge. With the loan of Ksh 30,000, she will be able to buy clothes for resale. Habiba’s primary customers are her neighbors, and her greatest monthly expense is food. She joined Yehu to get access to funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 39-year-old lady from Vihiga, married to Vincent, and they have four children.

Eunice operates a pharmacy, a business she has been doing for the last two years, and she makes a monthly income of about Kes 26,000. She is now taking her third loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy dispensing drugs.

She will use her profits to expand their medical clinic. Her dream is to build a big medical clinic.

loans.use: To buy dispensing drugs.

loans.name: Ferhizil

texts.en:
Ferhizil is a 28-year-old lady, married to Moses, and they have a nine-year-old child.

Ferhizil operates a mobile phone accessories shop, a business she has been doing for the last year, and she makes a monthly income of about KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock of mobile phone accessories. 

Her profits will be used to repay the loan. Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 26 years old and is married with two children ages 2 and 4. She is in the blue shirt in the picture. She sells tomatoes at the market and she has been in this business for 8 years. Her business is open from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day except on Sunday, and she currently employs four people to help her. 

Beatrice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more tomatoes for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, and she will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en: Nyamvula is a 49-year-old mother of six children, none of whom is attending school. She has been operating a grocery for the last 8 years, selling her goods at the market. Other sources of income include sales from farm produce. Nyamvula describes market competition to be her major challenge and she dreams of opening a kiosk in the future. She owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. She joined Yehu to get access to loans. Nyamvula spends more on food over the month. With the loan of Ksh 30,000, she plans to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Santos Adan

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 55 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa e hijos  en casa propia, en el distrito de Cayalti, departamento de Lambayeque; la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y algunos al comercio. Así mismo todos ellos cuentan con servicios básicos como luz, agua y desagüe.

La actividad principal a la que se dedica Santos es la crianza/venta de  animales menores como: patos, pavos, porcinos y caprinos, estos los cría en corrales que están instalados en la parte posterior de su casa, donde les da alimento balanceado y pastos naturales; Santos cuenta con 11 años de experiencia en este negocio, y comercializa sus animales a comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; además es trabajador eventual de una empresa de la zona, donde le permite tener otros ingresos. Su cónyuge también le apoya en este tipo de actividades.

 El  monto del préstamo que esta solicitando Santos es de S/. 3,000 nuevos soles, que será para la compra de alimentos balanceados y arreglo de corrales, de esta manera se propone capitalizar su negocio y  mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Santos is a gentleman who is 55 years of age and married. He lives with his wife and children in their own home, which is located in the District of Cayalti, Department of Lambayeque. Most of the residents engage in agriculture and breeding animals, but some are also involved in trade. Everyone in this area receives basic services such as electricity, running water, and drainage systems.

Santos raises and sells small animals such as ducks, turkeys, pigs, and goats as his main business activity. The animals are kept in an area behind his house and are given a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses. Santos has 11 years of experience in this business. The animals are sold to wholesale traders in the area. In addition, he is a seasonal worker for a company in the area. This allows him to earn additional income. His wife also helps him with these activities.

The loan amount Santos is requesting is 3,000 PEN, which will be used to buy balanced feed and to repair the animal pens. This will enable him to capitalize his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced animal feed and to repair his animal pens.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir, age thirty-two, is a car repair master. He is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. He works at his own auto repair shop. He has eleven years of experience in this area. His clients say that he is a hardworking, honest and positive person. Samir has applied for a loan of 300 AZN to buy saw stones to build his house.

loans.use: To buy saw stones to build his house.

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en:
Chhoun is from Pouk district. She is 32 years old and a married woman who is responsible for their only child who attends school. She, as well as other villagers, is in the business of making bamboo baskets, earning approximately USD 2.50 per day from this business. It is a common business for local people followed by rice farming. As usual, there are middlemen who frequently come to collect finished bamboo baskets from local villagers. 

Chhoun wants to fix some broken parts of her house. Due to inadequate capital, she is now asking for a loan of USD 1,300 to purchase some building materials to fix her house. She already hired the workers to perform these tasks. This loan will be her third loan from HKL and she believes that she will be able to further develop her living status through using it.

loans.use: to purchase some building materials to fix her house.

loans.name: Shamim Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Shamim bibi is a 44-year-old married woman, and by this relationship she has eight children: five daughters and three sons.  Shamim and all of her daughters are engaged in decorative embroidery work. They craft beautiful embroidered designs on clothes and fulfill the orders of their customers. One of her sons works in a factory, and a second reads in the 5th standard. The youngest son doesn’t do anything.  Her husband is a motor mechanic who works in a motor workshop where he repairs vehicles and earns income. He is very expert and experienced in his work.  

Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy beads, colored threads and sketches in larger quantity so that she and her daughters can all expand their business and make their profits double in size.

loans.use: To buy beads, colored threads and sketches for her decorative embroidery business.

loans.name: Anghela

texts.es:
Anghela, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como Abogada en una institución pública por más de ocho horas y lo que gana solo le alcanza para los gastos de su hijito ya que es muy pequeño aun, también  ayuda a sus padres a pagar los servicios básicos de la casa.  Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para pagar su tesis de grado, ya que no cuenta con otros ingresos.
 El sueño de Anghela, es tener mayores ingresos y conseguir una casa en anticretico para darle más comodidad a su hijo.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Anghela is a single mother and has one child. She lives at the home of her parents where they occupy one room. The house is located in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz.

Anghela currently works as an attorney for a public institution. She only earns enough to cover the expenses of her son, who is still very young. Also, her parents help out by paying for the basic household services. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to pay for the thesis required for her degree. She does not earn any other income.

Anghela's dream is to have more income so that she can acquire a house through an "anticrético" agreement (a contract to rent property whereby the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum at the start of the rental period in lieu of paying monthly rent; at the end of the rental period, the tenant receives the sum back, in full, from the landlord, thus resulting in rent-free living) and provide greater comfort for her son. This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the cost of preparing her thesis.

loans.name: Mnyevu

texts.en:
Mnyevu is a 52-year-old married woman with 6 children. 4 of whom are enrolled in school. She lives in her own house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mnyevu has operated a clothes business for the past 3 years. She sells at the market to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality as she sells less during rainy seasons. She aspires to expand her business so as to provide education to her children.

With the Kshs. 20,000 she wants to purchase new clothes to expand her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for her business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es: Eufemia desde hace 18 años se dedica a la confección de vestidos femeninos, multiusos y ropa en tejido de punto, simultáneamente vende helados en su propia casa y genera ingresos complementarios que apoyan el bienestar de su hogar.  Eufemia realiza sus compras  de contado, con una frecuencia semanal, a proveedores ubicados en el mercado público de la ciudad; Así mismo sus ventas las realiza de contado y es muy reconocida en el segmento en el cual interactúa, por eso cada vez tiene mas clientes y con ello su necesidad de capital de trabajo crecen y se hacen cada vez mas evidente, convirtiendo esta situación en uno de sus mayores desafíos. Eufemia tiene 1 años de estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y de la mano de esta organización, ha logrado aumentar sus posibilidades de responder a su clientela, desde el año 1998 cuando  inició en un grupo solidarios, donde estuvo hasta el siguiente años y solo fue hasta el año 2012 que reactivo su relación financiera con esta organización, accediendo a este,  su primer credikiva de manera individual, porque quiere continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo y ofrecer nuevas líneas de productos. Con su credikiva comprará materias primas e insumos, para producir vestidos encargados y también invertirá en la compra de helados y mekatos que aumenten su inventario y así mismo sus utilidades sobre las ventas, con el aprovechamiento de una época de gran movimiento comercial, como lo es el mes de Mayo que trae con ello celebraciones familiares, y religiosas,  que incrementan el consumo de los consumidores y hacen que su credikiva se convierta en una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Eufermia has been making women’s dresses, multi-purpose, and knitted clothing for eighteen years.  At the same time, she sells ice cream in her home and generates complementary income which supports the well-being of her household.  Eufemaia makes weekly cash purchases from suppliers located in the city’s public market.  She also makes her sales in cash and is very well known in the market where she conducts her business and consequently, she gains more customers each time. Therefore, it is becoming increasingly evident that she needs to increase her working capital, making this one of her greatest challenges. 

Eufemia has been connected with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for one year and at the hand of this organization, she has managed to increase her ability to respond to her customers.  She became a member of this supportive group in 1998 and remained with them for many years but it was not until 2012 that she reactivated her financial relationship with this organization.  She agreed to this, her first individual Kiva loan, because she wants to continue increasing her working capital and offering new product lines. With her Kiva loan, she will purchase raw materials and supplies in order to produce custom-made dresses and she will also invest in the purchase of ice cream and cakes to increase her inventory and likewise, her profits on sales.  Due to family and religious celebrations, consumer spending increases in the month of May and she will take advantage of this period of high commercial activity. In this way, her Kiva loan will become a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies to produce custom-made dresses and also to invest in the purchase of ice cream and cakes to increase her inventory.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El socio Luis nació en la ciudad de Cusco del departamento de Cusco y vive donde nació, él tiene 40 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos. El socio Luis es cheff y trabaja en un prestigioso restaurante de la ciudad del Cusco pero también tiene un pequeño taller mecánico. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio del taller y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio Luis requiere el préstamo para incrementar el capital de negocio del taller y desea comprar lubricantes y aceites. 
  
El socio Luis pertenece al banco comunal “San Antonio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Luis was born in the city of Cusco in the department of Cusco, and still lives where he was born.  He is 40 years old, is married, and has two children.  Luis is a chef and works at a famous restaurant in Cusco, but he also has a small automotive repair shop.  He has had his repair shop for three years and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  Luis is asking for a loan so he can increase his working capital for his repair shop and purchase automotive lubricants and oils.  

Luis belongs to the “San Antonio” Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the province of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase automotive lubricants and oils.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Miaraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a la venta de joyas de forma ambulante ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo y con esos ingresos solventa el pago de sus estudios en la universidad en la carrera de administración de empresas, por esta razón solicita el crédito para comprar más joyas y venderlas para obtener mayores ingresos y seguir pagando sus estudios.
El sueño de Graciela es terminar sus estudios y conseguir un buen trabaja para tener mejores ingresos y poder independizarse para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito en IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Graciela is single and has no children. She lives at the home of her parents, which is located in the District of Miraflores in the city of La Paz.

Graciela currently earns income by selling jewelry as a street vendor since she has no established vending post. With the income she earns, she is able to pay for her university studies since she is working toward a degree in Business Administration. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more jewelry that she can sell for additional income. This will enable her to continue paying for her studies.

Graciela's dream is to finish her studies and continue on to a good-paying job. This will allow her to become independent so that she can improve her quality of life. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is single with three children, and two are in school. She takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She operates a retail shop at home. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 3 years. She also gets additional income from selling charcoal. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, rice, maize flour, soap, and bags of sugar. Her major business challenges include increasing prices of commodities in Uganda, seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into a wholesale shop, and also to build rental houses. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Nzije

texts.en:
Nzije is a 24-year-old single woman with 1 child who is enrolled in school. She lives in her own house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and medical bills. 

Nzije has operated a food stall for the past 3 years. She sells from her home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She aspires to own a well stocked kiosk.

With the Ksh. 10,000 she wants to purchase additional stock like maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Bahruz

texts.en: Bahruz has ten years of experience as a taxi driver. He is a twenty-seven-year-old married man with two children, ages seven and four. He wants to access the loan of 1,500 AZN to barter his old car for a new one. He spends a lot of money on repairs and the new car will let him save his money.

loans.use: To barter his old car for a new one.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en: Eleuteria is 56 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 15, 21 and 38. She sells casserole dishes of different sizes to her community. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month with her business. She requested a loan to buy more casseroles to sell. Eleuteria hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more casseroles to sell.

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is married with two children, and only one of them goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (mother, sisters and brothers). She sells scrap from vehicles at the market. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy car scrap. Her major business challenges include thieves and transportation. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into a wholesale scrap business and of building her own house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more car scrap for resale.

loans.name: Frella Maria

texts.es: Frella es una madre de familia trabajadora. Empezó vendiendo artículos a crédito hasta que poco a poco su capital aumento y con la ayuda de su esposo logro iniciar su negocio. Su tienda está ubicada en sector llamada Flor de bastión es propia y lo abre de lunes a domingo. Por el momento es inconveniente que le causa temor es la delincuencia ya que su sector es algo peligroso. Su esposo Segundo (entre risas nos dice que solo de nombre ya que es el primero) trabaja hace 11 años como jardinero en una Coorporación Deportiva. Su familia es bien grande ya que tiene 5 hijos todos en etapa escolar y asisten a la escuela fiscal. Con el crédito piensa comprar víveres, azúcar, arroz, productos de limpieza, granos. A futuro tiene planeado mejorar su vivienda y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Frella is a hardworking mother. She began selling goods on credit and gradually increased her capital, which helped her husband start his business. Her store is located in an area called "Flor de Bastión". She owns her business and it is open Monday through Sunday. At the moment, the inconvenience that causes her worry is the crime that makes the area a bit dangerous. Her husband Segundo (which means "second", but she laughs because he is her first husband) has worked as a gardener for a sports cooperative for 11 years. Her family is quite large since she has five children, all of whom are of school age. They attend a state school.

Frella plans to use her loan to buy provisions, sugar, rice, cleaning products, and grains. In the future, she plans to improve her home and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions, sugar, rice, cleaning products, and grains.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 49-year-old married man with two children. He has been a taxi driver for about 20 years. He wants to make repairs to his house and needs to buy the materials to start it. Ali has applied for an 800 AZN loan. In the future, after he will finish with the loan for the repairs, he plans to change his car to a new one, as his car is not in good condition.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make repairs to his house

loans.name: Salaama

texts.en: Salaama is married with three children, and all of them go to school. She takes care of her mother.  She sells second-hand clothes and bed sheets at the market on a retail basis. She works six days each week. She has been in this business for three years. She also gets additional income from selling piped water to her neighbors. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes and bed sheets. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of clothes and defaulters. She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and to start importing clothes. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and buying food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and bed sheets

loans.name: Jhonnatan

texts.es:
Jhonnatan, es soltero y tiene un hijo pequeño, con el cual vive en una habitación en alquiler en la zona Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió solo hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente percibe ingresos por que trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada de seguridad  por más de ocho horas y con lo poco que gana cubre los gastos de su alquiler y la alimentación para su hijo. El trabajo que realiza Jhonnatan es peligroso ya que cubre algunos turnos toda la noche.
El crédito lo requiere para un anticretico ya que desea ahorrar y no pagar alquileres para invertir ese dinero en su hijo.
El sueño de Jhonnatan, es tener casa propia ya que quiere brindarle más seguridad y comodidad a su hijo y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Jhonnatan is single and has a young son. They live in a rented room in the District of Pampahasi in the city of La Paz.

Jhonnatan only has a high school education. He currently earns income by working for a private security company. Jhonnatan works more than eight hours. With what little that he earns, he is able to cover the rent and feed his son. His job is dangerous because he must work during some of the overnight shifts.

The loan he is requesting will be used to acquire housing through an "anticrético" agreement (a contract to rent property whereby the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum at the start of the rental period in lieu of paying monthly rent; at the end of the rental period, the tenant receives the sum back, in full, from the landlord, thus resulting in rent-free living). This will enable him to save and avoid paying rent. The money he saves will be invested in his son.

Jhonnatan dreams of having a house of his own so that he can provide more security and comfort for his son. He also wants to improve his income and his quality of life. This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to acquire housing through an "anticrético" agreement.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou est une femme veuve, mère de deux enfants qui vit au Sénégal. Son principale activité consiste a louer des magasins dont elle dispose chez elle. Elle a choisi son activité a travers l’opportunité qui s’est offerte a elle contenu de la localisation de sa maison. Cette activité qui est presque  dépourvue de charges à supporter régulièrement  constitue pour elle une importante source de profit. Elle est membre du guichet de  l’U-IMCEC de la zone  et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour réfectionner un de ses magasins en mauvais état. Ce  financement lui permettra de maintenir le niveau de ses revenus mensuels.
texts.en:
Fatou is a widow, mother of two children, who lives in Senegal.  Her main activity is to rent some shops that are part of her house.  She chose this activity because the opportunity presented itself, given the location of her house.  This activity, which is almost free of regular expenses, constitutes an important source of profits for her.

Fatou is a member of the local UIMCEC branch and she is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to repair one of her shops, currently in poor condition.   This loan will allow her to maintain, each month, her current income level.

loans.use: to repair one of her shops.

loans.name: Ehawa

texts.fr:
Ehawa est une femme âgé(e) de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chaudronnier. Elle a 02 enfants, tous à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 12 ans.  
Ehawa travaille comme revendeuse de produits de beauté depuis 2004. Elle vend dans une boutique au public et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Ehawa a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de beauté. Elle veut améliorer son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Ehawa is a 38-year-old woman, married to a coppersmith. She has two children, ages 15 and 12, who both attend school. 

Ehawa has been reselling beauty products since 2004.  She buys her goods in Lomé and sells in shop, open to the general public.

Ehawa has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy beauty products.  She wants to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en: Korpo lives in Paynesville. She is married and 41 years old. She has four children between 7 to 18 years old that are in school and live at home. Her husband is a government worker. For the past ten years, she has been running a provision shop, which sells rice, soap, toothpaste, oil, tissue, milk, batteries, and many other items. She says some problems she is facing are the location of her shop and having fewer commodities. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory (rice, soap, toothpaste, oil, tissue, milk, batteries, and many other items) for her shop. She says she is happy of her business for so many reasons: it keeps her busy, it builds her trust, and it makes her well-known (every one in her community looks up to her for help if the community needs it). She smiles as she says her plan is to expand her business and empower others with her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory (rice, soap, toothpaste, oil, tissue, milk, batteries, and many other items) for her shop

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: It is sixteen years since Aydin first engaged in agriculture. The scope of his business is animal sales. Aydin is a 36-year-old married man. He has three children. He loves his family and tries to give them the best living conditions. In the future, he plans to expand his business and start a big-horned animal business. Today, he wants to obtain a loan of 1000 AZN to buy eight lambs.

loans.use: To buy eight lambs

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a married man who describes himself as honest and outgoing. He has five children, ranging in age from 14 to 29 years old.

William operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located at a strategic area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as stiff competition in the area. He will use the 20000 KES loan to pay for the renovation of his cattle shelter.

His business goal is to be a supplier of high quality milk in Rongai town within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a well maintained dairy farm.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his cattle shelter.

loans.name: Protas

texts.en:
Protas is a 30-year-old man from Kisumu. He is married to Maurine. They have three children: one who is six years old and twins who are one year old.

Protas owns a restaurant business within Kisumu and has been doing this for the last six years. He makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. He is now taking out his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy foodstuffs like fish, cooking fat, maize flour, and other items. His profits will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for his restaurant like fish, cooking fat, maize flour, etc

loans.name: Ada Elvira

texts.es:
La socia Ada nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento de La Convención pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 53 años de edad y tiene una relación de union libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. La socia Ada se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo tejidos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Ada requiere el préstamo para comprar lana.  
  
La socia Ada pertenece al banco comunal “San Antonio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Ada is a member who was born in the city of Quillabamba in the Department of La Convención, but she lives in the city of Cusco. She is 53 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Ada makes woven handicrafts. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Ada is requesting a loan in order to buy wool.

She is a member of the San Antonio Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in Cusco Province.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 32-year-old single woman who describes herself as kind. She has four children, ranging in age from 4 to 12 years old. Previously, she was involved in selling fish. 

She operates a retail store where she sells ready-made clothes and children's clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a very attractive business area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Millicent describes her biggest business challenge as an insufficient stock of clothes to sell. She will use the 20000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to to open a wholesale clothing retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to provide the best for her family so they can live happily.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a prospective student applying for a loan to start his undergraduate work on a Bachelor's degree in Business Information Technology at Strathmore University. This is his story:

I am Victor, age 19, and I am an orphan from Laikipia, a rural and semi-arid district in Kenya. I succeeded in my final secondary school exams and was admitted to Strathmore University in Nairobi, Kenya, for a Bachelor's degree in Business Information Technology. However, due to financial challenges in my family, I’m unable to start university.
 
Until April this year, I have been teaching at a local primary school earning $38 US per month. Currently I am undertaking private studies to be a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) with the hope that this will complement my university education. After paying for my basic needs and the CPA exams, the money I earned from teaching was not enough to allow me make any savings for my university education. My elder sister is in college pursuing a Business Administration course, and it has been difficult for our aging grandmother to pay her fees due to her dwindling income from farming.
 
My desire has been to pursue a degree course specifically at Strathmore University because of its reputation for offering high quality and competitive courses. Strathmore’s top graduates are assured of getting jobs with well paying organizations within three months after graduation. At Strathmore University, I will work as hard as I did in high school to excel in my studies and in extracurricular activities. 

I selected my program because it prepares well for current and future career demands in areas of business and information technology. This will give me good prospects for either getting a job or being self employed offering consultancy services in diverse sectors of the economy. My goal for the future is not only to grow in my career, but to contribute to society by motivating and offering help to other needy students like me.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Business Information Technology at Strathmore University.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 61 years old, a businessman, and he is married to Mary who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with six adult children. He has been in a quarry mining business as a primary business and welding as a secondary business for the past 17 years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. John will use the loan to hire labor for the quarry business and buy old metals for the welding business. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will buy a dairy cow. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to hire labor for his quarry business and old metals for his welding business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 56 years old and an enterprising business lady. She is married to Joseph, who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been distributing bananas for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 19,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Grace will use the loan to buy ripe bananas to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a green grocer business which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy ripe bananas to sell.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en: Guldasta is a 37-year-old woman. She is a single mother with two children, ages ten and twelve. She is engaged in a trading business. Guldasta sells clothes for children and women, and also perfumes. Three years ago, she started her business with the 500 AZN. Today she has to take care of her business for the best of her children and that is why she has applied for 1,200 AZN to buy perfumes and children's clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 33 years old, married to Elizabeth, and blessed with three children aged ten, eight and six years respectively. He is a photographer, a business he started eight years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He wants to start another line of business, that is to open a barber shop, and has requested KES 20,000 to purchase two hair shaving machines and other equipment for his new line of business. He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children.

His dream is to be a leading entrepreneur in Eldoret as well as educate his children. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase two hair shaving machines and other equipment for use in the barber shop.

loans.name: Musa B.

texts.en:
Musa is an approximately forty-three-year-old man. He was born in Musai village, in northern Sierra Leone but now lives in Kabala town with his wife and four children. Musa has been a businessman for three years now. He sells rice, flour, iron corrugated zinc, cement, etc. in wholesale.  

Musa has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones from Kiva field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), in order to expand his business. He will use this loan to buy rice, flour, iron corrugated zinc, cement, etc. at wholesale to add to his current stock. In this way, his business will improve both in size and quality, attracting many customers into his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, iron corrugated zinc, cement, etc. at wholesale to add to his current stock

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 25 years old. She is married to Simon and together they have one child. She sells secondhand clothes and handbags and has been in the business for the past eight years earning a good income.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD, after she was introduced by one of their clients. She repaid her previous loan successfully and in time. She will use the loan amount to purchase inventory of clothes for resale in her business.

She hopes to expand her business and own a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Finah

texts.en:
Finah is an approximately thirty-four-year-old woman. She was born in Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone where she is living with her husband and child, who is attending primary school. Finah has been a businesswoman for two years now. She sells cosmetics – body lotions, sprays, soaps, etc. She also sells drinks.  

Finah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones from Kiva field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), in order to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy cosmetics and drinks at wholesale to add to her current stock. In this way, her business will improve both in size and quality, attracting many customers into her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics – body lotions, sprays, soaps, etc. at wholesale to add to her business
